Armenian monk Gregory of Nicopolis ( Gregory Makar ) ( Grégoire de Nicopolis ) brought ginger bread to Europe in 992 .
The custom was to bake white biscuits and paint them as window decorations .
German immigrants brought it to Sweden during the 13th century .
After , it was a confection made with honey and spices .
Records show that gingerbread biscuits were sold in monasteries , pharmacies and town square farmers ' markets in the 16th century .

Banksy 's first movie , Exit Through the Gift Shop , billed as `` the world 's first street art disaster movie , '' made its debut at the 2010 Sundance Film Festival .
According to graphic designer Tristan Manco and the book Home Sweet Home , Banksy `` was born in 1974 and raised in Bristol , England .
Banksy 's work started in the Bristol underground scene , which had collaborations between artists and musicians .
However , art auctioneers have been known to attempt to sell his street art on location and leave the problem of its removal in the hands of the winning bidder .
His satirical street art and mind-hurting pictures combine dark humor with graffiti .
Banksy displays his art on public surfaces such as walls and even going as far as to build physical prop pieces .
His style is similar to Blek le Rat , who began to work with stencils in 1981 in Paris , and to members of the anarcho-punk band Crass , which did a graffiti stencil campaign on the London Underground system in the late 1970s and early 1980s .
Such works have been done on streets , walls , and bridges of cities throughout the world .
Water flowing out of bogs has a characteristic brown color , which comes from dissolved peat tannins .
In general the low fertility and cool climate results in relatively slow plant growth , but decay is even slower owing to the saturated soil .
It is one of the four main types of wetlands .
Bogs have a distinctive group of plant and animal species , and are of high importance for biodiversity , particularly in landscapes that are otherwise settled and farmed .
Bogs occur where the water at the ground surface is acidic and low in nutrients .
Large areas of landscape can be covered many meters deep in peat .
Frequently , as the illustration on the right shows , they are covered in Ericaceous shrubs rooted in the Sphagnum moss and peat .
The gradual accumulation of decayed plant material in a bog forms a carbon sink .
Other names for bogs include mire , quagmire and muskeg .
Hence peat accumulates .
A bog is a wetland that accumulates peat , a deposit of dead plant material-often mosses , in most cases , Sphagnum moss .
Creatine is used for the production of adenosine triphosphate ( ATP ) , which is the human body 's energy .
Creatine is a combination of three non-essential amino acids , methionine , arginine and glycine .
There are fewer Western people than in the larger centers of Abu Dhabi and Dubai .
Important buildings include United Arab Emirates University , Higher Colleges of Technology , well-equipped medical facilities , including the teaching hospital at Tawam , military training areas and Al Ain International Airport .
It is often called the ` Garden City of the Persian Gulf ' because of the many parks , tree-lined avenues and decorative roundabouts within the city .
Al Ain regularly records the highest summer temperatures in the country , but the dry desert air makes it a welcome escape from the coastal humidity of the larger cities .
The city is home to the successful association football ( soccer ) club , Al Ain FC .
Other attractions include the Al Ain Oasis in the city center , and other oases around the area , cool places to escape the summer heat , a zoo , amusement park named `` Fun City '' , many well kept parks , popular with families in the summer evenings , a heritage village , as well as malls and other modern sites .
Al Ain ( Arabic : العين ) is a city in the United Arab Emirates .
Al Ain is becoming a place that tourists visit , with attractions such as Jebel Hafeet , a 1340 metre high mountain that dominates the surrounding area .
The city is in the emirate of Abu Dhabi , right next to the border with Oman .
There are more Emirati nationals in Al Ain than other places in the country , but most who live there are people who left other countries , particularly from the Indian sub-continent .

Tallari finished the season as the EIHL 's second highest goal scorer , with 55 goals and 38 assists in 59 games .
For example , A0 denotes the hottest stars in the A class and A9 denotes the coolest ones .
The Sun is classified as G2 .
The spectral classes O through M are subdivided by Arabic numerals ( 0-9 ) .
The Harvard classification system is a one-dimensional classification scheme .
Physically , the classes indicate the temperature of the star 's atmosphere and are normally listed from hottest to coldest , as is done in the following table : Note : The conventional color description describe only the peak of the stellar spectrum .
The closest star to the Earth , the sun , is a class G star .
If you are here because this happened to you , there are two possibilities .
While some users can use them to circumvent censorship or filters , they have been used far too many times by far too many blocked vandals for Wikipedians to assume good faith on their part .
While it is possible to request a change in username , this takes a little longer and requires that a user with bureaucrat access do so .
These messages should include the names or abbreviations of those of our site rules ( the `` policies and guidelines '' ) that the blocking administrator believes you have violated .
Whichever method you choose , it is a good idea to have some review of the proposed new username first , to avoid ending up in the same quandary .
This includes Tor nodes .
If you are improperly blocked for sockpuppetry , you should realize that it may not always be easy or even possible to correct the situation .
Users confirmed or believed to have engaged in the practice must request unblock at their main account .
Most administrators consider such an unblock request a sure sign of a sock account ( particularly one with very few changes otherwise ) and will decline on that basis .
Most such accounts are soft-blocked , meaning a new account may be created while the old one is blocked .
It may help with your unblock request if you understand how they are reviewed , and by who .
First , the blocking administrator provides a brief reason that you will see when you try to make a change .
Second , he may leave a message explaining your block on your user talk page .
Accusations of sockpuppetry result in many blocks and almost as many unblock requests , as Wikipedia policy calls for the sockpuppet account to be blocked indefinitely and the sockpuppeteer to be blocked for some length of time .
This is done because it is the account name , not the behavior of the person behind it , which is the problem .
You should also review the blocking policy .
Before you make an unblock request , you should read the policies and guidelines named in your block reason .
An account with a username that indicates that they are trying to be disruptive , uses hateful or obscene language or otherwise shows that the user has disruptive or provocative intent will be hard blocked , meaning that an unblock request will be required .
If your server has been blocked as an open proxy , you will probably need to change using another connection : in most cases , proxies are `` hard blocked '' , which stops even logged-in users from using the connection to change .
Reviewing admins will usually defer to the blocking admin in a sockpuppetry-based block , especially if the sock account has few changes .
Meatpuppets will be blocked indefinitely , too ... do n't change on behalf of someone else , no matter how well you may know them .
To contest your block well , you must understand the reason for it .
Wikipedia policy on open proxies is clear : they are blocked for a long time without exception once identified .
Accounts with usernames that violate the username policy are often blocked indefinitely , regardless of their changing behavior .
Also , if the reviewing administrator decides that the block was justified , she will not unblock you unless she is convinced that you understand what you are blocked for , and that you will not do it again .
Do n't forget to insert your own reason .
Wikipedia admins can never be absolutely sure about sockpuppetry , and the most abusive users can be very sneaky in trying to stop detection .
Even without the use of Checkuser , or with a result of `` unrelated '' , an account that makes the same changes as a different blocked account , has the same linguistic peculiarities and the same general interests may remain blocked .
You , as a blocked user , are responsible for convincing administrators : Making convincing unblock requests is also important for other reasons : To make an unblock request , copy the following text to the bottom of your user talk page : -LCB- -LCB- unblock  1 = Insert your reason to be unblocked here -RCB- -RCB- .
This is a guide to making believable unblock requests .
This is a list of bad unblock requests : If you state in your request that the changes which led to your block were made by someone else who logged on to your account without your knowledge or permission , we will have to leave it blocked and request that you start over with a new account .
` Do not ' make an unblock request that includes a request for checkuser to `` prove your innocence '' .
Sometimes readers who have never or rarely changed before , or not from that location , with no goal of making an account , click on `` change this page '' only to find that changing from their IP address is blocked , for something they did n't do .
As a user requesting to be unblocked , it is your responsibility to tell clearly and briefly , in easily readable English , why your block violated Wikipedia 's blocking policy .
Users may be blocked from changing Wikipedia by administrators to stop damage or disruption to Wikipedia .
Blocks are canceled if they are not ( or no longer ) needed to stop such damage or disruption .
You are told about the block reason in two ways .
They are usually one or more from among the following : Vandalism , sockpuppetry , spamming or having a bad username .

They called this object Teide 1 and it was found in the Pleiades open cluster .
The discovery of deuterium-burning down to 0.012 solar masses and the impact of dust formation in the cool outer atmospheres of brown dwarfs in the late 1980s brought these theories into question .
This discovery helped to establish yet another spectral class even cooler than L dwarfs , known as `` T dwarfs '' , for which Gliese 229B is the prototype .
Remarkably , its near-infrared spectrum clearly exhibited a methane absorption band at 2 micrometres , a feature that had previously only been observed in the atmospheres of giant planets and that of Saturn 's moon Titan .
Soon after the discovery of GD 165B , other brown-dwarf candidates were reported .
Although the discovery of the coolest dwarf was highly significant at the time , it was debated whether GD 165B would be classified as a brown dwarf or simply a very-low-mass star , because observationally it is very difficult to distinguish between the two .
Today , GD 165B is recognized as the prototype of a class of objects now called `` L dwarfs '' .
Most failed to live up to their candidacy , however , because the absence of lithium showed them to be stellar objects .
Alternative names for brown dwarfs were proposed , including planetar and substar .
Their strongest emissions are in the infrared ( IR ) spectrum , and ground-based IR detectors were too imprecise at that time to readily identify any brown dwarfs .
However , such objects were hard to find because they emit almost no visible light .
Nature highlighted `` Brown dwarfs discovered , official '' in the front page of that issue .
A brown dwarf below 65 Jupiter masses is unable to burn lithium by thermonuclear fusion at any time during its evolution .
The distance , chemical composition , and age of Teide 1 was established because it is in the young Pleiades star cluster .
Teide 1 was considered for some time the smallest object out of the Solar System that had been identified by direct observation .
Brown dwarfs more massive than 13 MJ are thought to fuse deuterium and those above ~ 65 MJ , fuse lithium as well .
Some are very close to Earth such as Epsilon Indi Ba and Bb , a pair of brown dwarfs gravitationally bound to a sunlike star around 12 light-years from the Sun , and WISE 1049-5319 a binary system of brown dwarfs about 6.5 light-years away .
For many years , efforts to discover brown dwarves were fruitless .
Their mass is between the heaviest gas giants and the lightest stars , with an upper limit around 75 to 80 times the mass of Jupiter ( MJ ) .
High-quality spectral data showed that Teide 1 had kept the initial lithium amount of the original molecular cloud from which Pleiades stars formed .
In 1994\/5 the study of brown dwarfs changed with the discovery of two definite substellar objects ( Teide 1 and Gliese 229B ) .
One school of thought is based on formation , and another on interior physics .
In 1988 , however , GD 165B was discovered , showing none of the features expected of a low-mass red dwarf star .
For some years now there has been debate concerning what criterion to use for defining the separation between a very-low-mass brown dwarf and a giant planet ( ~ 13 Jupiter masses ) .
Early theories suggested that an object less than 0.09 solar masses would never go through normal stellar evolution .
What became known as brown dwarfs were talked about in the 1960s .
Confusingly , brown dwarves have temperatures and luminosities similar to some true stars .
The nearest known brown dwarf is WISE 1049-5319 about 6.5 light years away , a binary system of brown dwarves discovered in 2013 .
In other words , the detection of lithium in the atmosphere of an object means that , if it is older than 100 my , it is a brown dwarf .
More notable was Gliese 229B , which was found to have a temperature and luminosity well below the stellar range .

The show ended with 13 episodes in one season .
It is known from a well preserved partial skeleton that includes four long feathers on the tail , composed of a central rachis and vanes .
Zhang et al. suggest that unless Epidexipteryx evolved from flying ancestors and subsequently lost its wings , this may indicate that advanced display feathers on the tail may have predated flying or gliding flight .
It had teeth only in the front of the jaws , with unusually long front teeth angled forward , a feature only seen in Masiakasaurus among other theropods .
In all , the skeleton of Epidexipteryx hui measures 25 centimeters ( 10 inches ) in length ( 44.5 cm or 17.5 in including the incomplete tail feathers ) , and the authors estimated a weight of 164 grams , smaller than most other early dinobirds .
The tail of Epidexipteryx bore unusual vertebrae towards the tip which resembled the feather-anchoring pygostyle of modern birds and some oviraptors .
Epidexipteryx is the earliest known example of ornamental feathers in the fossil record .
Epidexipteryx also preserved a covering of simpler body feathers .
However , unlike in modern-style tail feathers , the vanes were not branched but made up of a single ribbon-like sheet .
It is a small maniraptoran dinosaur from the Middle or Upper Jurassic age Daohugou Beds of Inner Mongolia , China ( perhaps 152 to 168 million years ago ) .
Epidexipteryx ( ` display feather ' ) is a genus of small maniraptoran dinosaurs , known from one fossil specimen in Beijing .
They are unique in that some appear to arise from a `` membranous structure '' .
The skull of Epidexipteryx is also unique in a number of features .
Despite its close relationship to avialan birds , Epidexipteryx appears to have lacked wing feathers , and so it could not fly .

The ` small casinos ' will have a minimum customer area of 750 sq metres , up to 80 slot machines and a jackpot of # 4000 .
Definitions have been determined such that the ` super casino ' will have a minimum customer area of 5000 square metres and at most 1250 unlimited-jackpot slot machines .
Under the terms of the Gambling Act the Secretary of State is able to define each type of Casino , with reference to any matter he or she chooses ; although the act specifically mentions as facts to consider the number , location and concentration of gaming tables , and the floor area designated for a specific purpose .
Amongst the most controversial provisions was the establishment of a number of ` destination casinos ' in the style of Las Vegas , commonly referred to in the media as ` Super Casinos ' Initial drafts of the act proposed eight regional casinos but concerns expressed in the national media and by a range of addiction related social and religious groups meant that the final revision of the act permitted only one casino of the largest size , referred to as a ` Regional Casino ' , with a further eight ` large ' and eight ` small ' casinos of a smaller sizes and with reduced Jackpot limits .
In May 2006 , a short-list of eight sites , selected from various ones submitted by local councils , was announced for the location of the Regional Casino .
However , the Blackpool bid organisers pledged to continue the work in getting government approval for a ` supercasino ' .
` Large casinos ' will have a minimum area of 1000 square metres and up to 150 slot machines with a maximum jackpot of # 4000 .
The Gambling Act 2005 revised many regulations relating to gambling in England .
Customers were required to register twenty-four hours prior to gaming .
A Regional Casino , more commonly known as a Super Casino ( or occasionally known as Mega Casino ) , is the term given to the largest category of casino that was to have been permitted under UK law .
Prior to the act there were 140 casinos in the UK , the largest of which in Star City , Birmingham had a floor area of around 950 square metres .
These were : On 30 January 2007 it was announced that the first Regional Casino would be built in East Manchester near the City of Manchester Stadium .
This was a shock to the Blackpool and The O2 ( formerly the Millennium Dome ) bids .
This was stopped by the UK government soon after Gordon Brown became Prime Minister of the United Kingdom .

James Gaye Stewart ( June 28 , 1923 - November 18 , 2010 ) was a professional ice hockey forward .
In all , Gaye Stewart played for five of the NHL 's Original Six teams , all except the Boston Bruins .
After spending two years in the Royal Canadian Navy during World War II , Stewart returned to the NHL in 1945 and had his best season , leading the league with 37 goals - the last time a Leaf led the League in scoring .
He played nine seasons as a left winger in the National Hockey League .
He became the first player to win the Stanley Cup before the Calder .
The next season , Stewart won the 1943 Calder Trophy , beating out Maurice ` The Rocket ' Richard of the Montreal Canadiens .
Danny Grant , Tony Esposito and Ken Dryden have accomplished it as well since then .
Stewart won his second Stanley Cup , again with the Maple Leafs , in 1947 .
Born in Fort William , Ontario , Stewart was promoted from the minors in 1942 to play in one game of the Stanley Cup Finals , where he helped the Toronto Maple Leafs win the championship .
Toronto traded Stewart to Chicago early in the 1947-48 season in a deal that brought Max Bentley to the Leafs , and he had three 20-goal seasons for the Black Hawks before finishing his career with stints in Detroit , New York and Montreal .
His works were a great influence on later writers like Ivan Turgenev , Ivan Goncharov and Leo Tolstoy .
Vertical distance measurements in the `` down '' direction are commonly referred to as depth .
At high altitude , atmospheric pressure is lower than that at sea level .
This climate affects the ecology at high altitude .
People living at higher elevations have a higher rate of suicide .
This can cause illnesses such as altitude sickness , High altitude pulmonary edema ( fluid in the lungs ) , and High altitude cerebral edema ( fluid in the brain , causing headaches and confusion ) .
High altitude is often said to begin at 2,400 metres ( 8,000 ft ) above sea level .
Altitudes above 1,500 metres ( 4,900 ft ) start to affect humans .
There are several types of aviation altitude .
This causes an alpine climate .
The height is either from the average sea level ( also called Mean Sea Level or MSL ) , or from the ground ( also called Above Ground Level , or AGL ) .
Gravity makes the air to be as close as possible to the ground .
The common pressure altimeter is a type of barometer with a dial showing distance ( feet or metres ) instead of atmospheric pressure .
The human body can deal with high altitude by breathing faster , having a higher heart rate , and changing the blood itself to have more red blood cells that can carry oxygen .
This can take days or weeks to happen .
As it rises , it can expand and it begins to cool .
Altitude means height above the ground or above the sea level .

It is 16 inches tall , weighs over 12 pounds , cast in solid bronze , and produced by the American Fine Arts Foundry in Burbank , California .
A Screen Actors Guild Award is an award given by the Screen Actors Guild ( SAG ) to recognize outstanding performances by its members .
Nominations for the awards come from 4200 randomly selected members of the union , with the full membership ( 120,000 as of 2007 ) available to vote for the winners .

2 ( Two ; i \/ ˈtuː \/ ) is a number , numeral , and glyph .
The square root of two was the first known irrational number .
If the last digit of a number is even , then the number is even .
The next prime number is three .
Two has many meanings in math .
Two also has the unique property that 2 +2 = 2 · 2 = 2 ² .
Two is the smallest , first , and only even prime number .
The binary way is the simplest system of numbers in which natural numbers ( 0-9 ) can be written .

The main axis of the state is the Rhine river , that forms the border with Baden-Württemberg and Hesse in the southeast before running across the northern part of Rhineland-Palatinate .
The Ministers President since 1947 : Rhineland-Palatinate is divided into 24 districts , grouped into the three administrative regions : Koblenz , Trier and Rheinhessen-Pfalz .
It was formed from the northern part of the French Occupation Zone ( the Rhenish Palatinate or German : pfalz which had been a part of Bavaria ) as well as the southern parts of the Prussian Rhine Province , Birkenfeld which formerly belonged to Oldenburg , parts of the Prussian Province of Nassau ( see Hesse-Nassau ) , and parts of Hesse-Darmstadt as well as Rheinhessen on the western banks of the Rhine .
The capital is Mainz .
These mountains are separated from each other by the tributaries of the Rhine : the Moselle ( Mosel ) , the Lahn and the Nahe .
Rhineland-Palatinate borders on ( from the north and clockwise ) North Rhine-Westphalia ( another German state ) , Hesse ( another German state ) , Baden-Württemberg ( another German state ) , France , Saarland ( another German state ) , Luxembourg , and Belgium .
The Rhine Valley is bounded by mountains with some of the historically most significant places of Germany .
Rhineland-Palatinate was created on 30 August 1946 .

Santiago de Cuba province has been the site of many battles , both during the war for independence and the 1959 Cuban Revolution , where much of the guerrilla fighting took place in the mountainous province .
Santiago de Cuba Province is the second most populated province in the island of Cuba .
The natural beauty of the area is attracting many tourists from both the rest of Cuba and from overseas .
One of these was Oriente province , which was , prior to 1905 , known as Santiago de Cuba province .
Industry is growing around the capital , as is tourism .
The economy , however , relies mostly on agriculture , with large plantations growing bananas , cacao and coffee dotting the landscape .
The largest city Santiago de Cuba ( 554,000 ) is its main administrative center .
The province has many material resources such as iron and nickel .
Before 1976 , Cuba was divided into six provinces .
Examples of such organometallic compounds include all Gilman reagents , which contain lithium and copper .
For example , hemoglobin and myoglobin contain an iron center coordinated to the nitrogen atoms of a porphyrin ring ; magnesium is the center of a chlorin ring in chlorophyll .
The field of such inorganic compounds is known as bioinorganic chemistry .
Metal beta-diketonates , alkoxides , and dialkylamides are representative members of this class .
Organometallic chemistry is the study of chemical compounds containing bonds between carbon and a metal .
In certain organometallic compounds such as ferrocene or dibenzenechromium , the pi orbitals of the organic moiety ligate the metal .
However , methylcobalamin ( a form of Vitamin B12 ) , with a cobalt-methyl bond , is a true organometallic complex , one of the few known in biology .
Two important classes are organolithium and Grignard reagents .
Many complexes have coordination bonds between a metal and organic ligands .
The term `` metalorganics '' usually refers to metal-containing compounds lacking direct metal-carbon bonds but which contain organic ligands ( carbon chains hanging near the metal atom ) .
The organic ligands often bind the metal through a heteroatom such as oxygen or nitrogen , in which case such compounds are called `` coordination compounds '' .
Organometallic chemistry combines aspects of inorganic chemistry ( the study of non-carbon bonds ) and organic chemistry ( the study of carbon bonds ) .
Organometallic compounds with bonds that have characters in between ionic and covalent are very important in industry .
In addition to the traditional metals , elements such as boron , silicon , arsenic , and selenium form organometallic compounds , e.g. organoborane compounds such as triethylborane ( Et3B ) .
The metal-carbon bond in organometallic compounds is half way between being ionic and covalent .
Many organic coordination compounds occur in nature .
They are distinguished by the prefix `` organo - '' ( for example , organopalladium compounds ) .
It is the tallest building in the United States that is west of the Mississippi River .
U.S. Bank Tower is a skyscraper in Los Angeles , California , United States .

Some do enormous harm to humans and their livestock .

Squid have the largest eyes in the animal kingdom .
In 1978 , sharp , curved claws on the suction cups of squid tentacles cut up the rubber coating on the hull of the USS Stein .
The Kraken is a legendary tentacled monster possibly based on sightings of real giant squid .
In February 2007 , a New Zealand fishing vessel caught a Colossal Squid weighing 495 kilograms ( 1,091 lb ) and measuring around 10 metres ( 33 ft ) off the coast of Antarctica .
The size suggested the largest squid known at the time .
Most squid are no more than 60 centimetres ( 24 in ) long , although the giant squid may reach 13 metres ( 43 ft ) .
The skin is covered in chromatophores , which enable the squid to change color to suit its surroundings , making it effectively camouflaged .
Squid , like cuttlefish , have eight arms arranged in pairs , and two longer tentacles with suckers .
Squid are cephalopods of the order Teuthida .
Squids have a head-like structure , with sense organs and brains in the front end .

A birth certificate is a vital record that documents the birth of a child .
The certificate itself usually includes some or all of the following information : Most countries have statutes and laws that regulate the registration of births .
In the United States , it is the responsibility of the mother 's physician , midwife , or a hospital administrator to prepare the official birth certificate .

The stretch of DNA that is transcribed into an RNA molecule is called a transcription unit .
The other strand is called the coding strand .
The matching RNA strand is a ` pre-messenger RNA ' .
The DNA sequence is copied by a special enzyme called RNA polymerase to make a matching RNA strand .
Diffraction occurs with all waves , including sound waves , water waves , and electromagnetic waves such as light that the eye can see .
Ellison co-founded Oracle Corporation in 1977 with Bob Miner and Ed Oates under the name Software Development Laboratories ( SDL ) .
He also served as the Chairman of the Board until his replacement by Jeffrey O. Henley in 2004 .
On August 22 , 2008 the Associated Press ranked Ellison as the top-paid chief executive in the world .
In 1979 SDL changed its name to Relational Software , Inc. ( RSI ) .
In 1995 , Oracle Systems Corporation changed its name to Oracle Corporation .
The company also builds tools for database development and systems of middle-tier software , enterprise resource planning software ( ERP ) , customer relationship management software ( CRM ) and supply chain management ( SCM ) software .
Part of Oracle Corporation 's early success came from using the C programming language to install its products .
He had also heard about the IBM System R database from an article in the IBM Research Journal by Ed Oates .
Ellison wanted to make Oracle 's product compatible with System R , but IBM stopped this by keeping the error codes for their DBMS ( DataBase Management System ) secret .
Ellison had read a 1970 paper written by Edgar F. Codd on relational database management systems ( RDBMS ) .
As of 2013 ( update ) , Larry Ellison , a co-founder of Oracle Corporation , has served as Oracle 's CEO throughout its history .
At this stage Bob Miner was the company 's senior programmer .
In 1982 , RSI renamed itself Oracle Systems to make the relation to its main product , Oracle Database , clearer .
Oracle Corporation is an American company .
It makes hardware systems and enterprise software ( software for businesses ) such as database management systems .
By 2007 Oracle had the third-largest software revenue , after Microsoft and IBM .

Anthology is a compilation album by Canadian singer-songwriter Bryan Adams which contains songs he recorded from 1978 through 2005 .
The album was released on October 18 , 2005 and features songs like `` Heat of the Night '' , and `` Summer of ' 69 '' .
Anthology co-produced by Adams , Robert Lange and Bob Clearmountain , peaked at number 65 on the Billboard 200 .
On the second disc , The North American edition has two songs from his Album Room Service and a new recorded version of `` When You 're Gone '' with Pamela Anderson , while the International edition has the Chicane song `` Do n't Give Up '' in place of Chicane 's remix of `` Cloud Number Nine '' , and a new song `` I 'm Not the Man You Think I Am '' ( from the movie Colour Me Kubrick ) , and the original version of `` When You 're Gone '' with Mel C. instead .
A third disc which was a DVD live concert which was recorded in mid 2005 called `` Live in Lisbon '' was included in North America for a limited time .
Anthology peaked at 4 on the Canadian Album Chart 29 on the UK Albums Chart and was certified two times platinum in Canada and gold in the UK .

The Battle of Marathon is perhaps now more famous as the inspiration for the Marathon race .
In response to this raid , Darius swore to burn Athens and Eretria to the ground .
The defeat at Marathon marked the end of the first Persian invasion of Greece .
Although historically inaccurate , the legend of a Greek messenger running to Athens with news of the victory became the inspiration for this athletic event , introduced at the 1896 Athens Olympics , and originally run between Marathon and Athens .
The Battle of Marathon was a watershed in the Greco-Persian wars , showing the Greeks that the Persians could be beaten .
After Darius died , his son Xerxes I re-started the preparations for a second invasion of Greece , which finally began in 480 BC .
Once the Ionian revolt was crushed by the Persian victory at the Battle of Lade , Darius began planning to conquer Greece .
Then , Athens and Eretria had sent a force to support the cities of Ionia , who were trying to overthrow Persian rule .
However , in 486 BC , his Egyptian subjects revolted , postponing any Greek expedition .
In 490 BC , he sent a naval task force under Datis and Artaphernes across the Aegean , to subjugate the Cyclades , the group of Greek islands in the Aegean Sea .
The next two hundred years saw the rise of the Classical Greek civilization , which has been so influential in western society .

It was part of the first Greco-Persian war .

The last Leonid storms were in 1999 , 2001 ( two ) , and 2002 ( two ) .
Leonid storms gave birth to the term `` meteor shower '' when it was first realized , during the November 1833 storm , that the meteors radiated from near the star Gamma Leonis .
Before that , there were storms in 1767 , 1799 , 1833 , 1866 , 1867 , and 1966 .
NASA has a useful tool to calculate how many meteors per hour are visible from your observing location .
A meteor shower is the result of an interaction between a planet , such as Earth , and streams of debris from a comet .
When the Leonid shower is not storming it is less active than the Perseids .
The Leonid meteor shower peaks around 17 November of each year .
The fragments tend to fall apart quickly into dust , sand , and pebbles , and spread out along the orbit of the comet to form a dense meteoroid stream , which later moves into Earth 's path .
About every 33 years , the Leonid shower produces a big meteor storm , peaking at thousands of meteors per hour .
The most visible meteor shower in most years are the Perseids , which peak on 12 August each year at over one meteor per minute .
The meteoroids spread out along the entire orbit of the comet to form a meteoroid stream , also known as a `` dust trail '' .
Most meteors are smaller than a grain of sand , so almost all of them burn up and never hit the Earth 's surface .
They originated from a breakup of asteroid-like objects , 2003 EH1 and 3200 Phaethon , respectively , about 500 and 1000 years ago .
Most of our short-period meteor showers are the product of rare disintegrations , when large chunks break off a mostly dormant comet .
Comets are dirty snowballs , made up of rock embedded in ice , orbiting the Sun .
Each time a comet swings by the Sun in its orbit , some of its ice vaporizes and meteoroids will be shed .
These meteors are caused by meteoroids entering Earth 's atmosphere at extremely high speeds on parallel paths .
A meteor shower is an event when many meteors seem to come from one point in the night sky .
He carried out `` the single most outstanding act of explosive ordnance disposal ever recorded in Afghanistan '' .
His father was serving in the Royal Electrical and Mechanical Engineers .
He was awarded the George Cross because he made safe over 80 improvised explosive devices in Afghanistan .

His letters gave foundation to the easy and popular Urdu .
Most notably , he wrote several ghazals during his life , which have since been interpreted and sung in many different ways by different people .
letters ... Not only Urdu poetry but the prose is also indebted to Mirza Ghalib .
Before Ghalib , letter writing in Urdu was highly ornamental .
He made his letters `` talking '' by using words and sentences as if he is talking to the reader .
According to him `` sau kos say ba-zabaan-e-qalam baateiN kiya karo aur hijr meiN visaal kay ma-zay liya karo '' ( from hundred of miles talk with the tongue of the pen and enjoy the joy of meeting even when you are separated ) His letters were very informal , some times he will just write the name of the person and start the letter .
He is considered to be the most popular and influential poet of the Urdu language .
He himself was very humorous and also made his letter very interesting .
Mirza Ghalib become orphaned when he was just 5 years old .

The age of majority in the Republic of Ireland is 18 , but a person must be over 21 years old to stand for election .
This is a list of the age of majority in various countries ( or administrative divisions ) :
For example , the youngest a person is allowed to purchase alcohol is 21 in all U.S. states even though the age of majority is 18 .
The law in a given place may never actually use the words `` age of majority '' when deciding when people become adults .
Even after a person reaches the age of majority , there may be other age-based rules that they still have to follow , such as the right to stand for office in elections or become a judge .
Verwoerd once described apartheid as a `` policy of good neighbourliness '' .
Three days before his death , Verwoerd held talks with the Prime Minister of the Lesotho , one of the native tribes in South Africa , Chief Leabua Jonathan , at the Union Buildings in Pretoria .
Following the meeting , a joint statement was issued by the two governments with special emphasis on `` co-operation without interference in each others ' internal affairs '' .
Verwoerd was rushed to Groote Schuur Hospital , but was declared dead upon arrival .
Verwoerd is often called the `` Architect of Apartheid '' for his role in apartheid policy when he was Minister of Native Affairs and then Prime Minister .
Hendrik Frensch Verwoerd ( September 8 , 1901 - September 6 , 1966 ) was Prime Minister of South Africa from 1958 to 1966 .
A parliamentary messenger named Dimitri Tsafendas stabbed Verwoerd in the neck and chest four times before other Assembly members restrained him .
On 6 September 1966 , Verwoerd was murdered in Cape Town , shortly after entering the House of Assembly at 2:15 pm .
Members who were also trained as medical practitioners rushed to aid Verwoerd and started giving cardiopulmonary resuscitation .

During the Tang Dynasty , the area to be known as Chang ` an included the area inside the Ming Xi'an fortification , plus some small areas to its east and west , and a major part of its southern suburbs .
The imperial city of Chang ` an during the Han Dynasty was in northwest of today 's Xi'an .
Around 750 A.D. Chang ` an was called a `` million people 's city '' in Chinese records , while modern estimates put it at around 800,000-1 ,000,000 within city walls .
During this time Chang ` an was one of the largest and most populous cities in the world .
During the Xin Dynasty , the city was renamed `` Constant Peace '' ; yet after its fall in the year 23 AD , the old name was restored .
During the Ming Dynasty , the name was changed to its present name Xi'an , meaning `` Western Peace '' .
Chang ` an literally means `` Perpetual Peace '' in Classical Chinese .
The Tang Chang ` an was 8 times the size of the Ming Xi'an .
Chang ` an was the capital of ancient China of more than ten dynasties in Chinese history .

The Division of Werriwa is a Federal Electoral Division for the Australian House of Representatives in the state of New South Wales .
Werriwa was the electorate ( 1952-78 ) of former Prime Minister Gough Whitlam .
The division was one of the original 75 divisions for Australia 's first federal election in 1901 .
In a by-election in March 2005 , Labor 's Chris Hayes was elected with over 55 % of the vote .
The name Werriwa is the local Aboriginal name for Lake George .
The Australian Electoral Commission tries to keep the names of original Federation electorates .
From 1994 to 2005 the Werriwa was held by one of Whitlam 's former aides , Mark Latham .

The River Irwell is a 39 miles ( 63 km ) long river which flows through the Irwell Valley in the counties of Lancashire and Greater Manchester in North West England .
The Irwell flows through the city centres of Manchester and Salford , before joining the River Mersey near Irlam .

Many of his most famous paintings come from this period .
He died in 1931 of cancer in Kallista near Melbourne .
In Australia , he built a house at Kallista , near Melbourne .
He spent World War I in England helping at a hospital .
He is buried near near Longford , Tasmania .
Thomas William `` Tom '' Roberts ( 9 March 1856 - 14 September 1931 ) was an Anglo-Australian artist .
He married 35 year old Elizabeth ( Lillie ) Williamson in 1896 .
Many examples of Roberts ' work can be seen at the National Gallery of Australia .
Elizabeth died in January 1928 .
His most famous works , in his time , were two large works , Shearing the Rams and The Big Picture .
This was a happy period in Roberts ' life .
Roberts had a theme of showing country people working .
Through the 1880s and 1890s he worked in Victoria .
He studied art at night under Louis Buvelot .
Laura Elizabeth Dern ( born February 10 , 1967 ) is an American actress .
She was born in Los Angeles , California and is the daughter of actors Bruce Dern ( born 1936 ) and Diane Ladd ( born 1935 ) .
The parts of the body affected by early symptoms of ALS depend on which muscles in the body are affected first .
Other limb onset patients first see the effects of the disease on a hand or arm as they have a difficult time with simple tasks requiring hand dexterity , or ability to move small things , such as buttoning a shirt , writing , or turning a key in a lock .
The earliest symptoms may include twitching , cramping , or stiffness of muscles ; muscle weakness affecting an arm or a leg ; slurred and strange-sounding nasal speech ; or having a difficult time chewing or swallowing .
The disorder causes muscle weakness and muscle shrinking ( atrophy ) throughout the body .
Unable to function , the muscles gradually weaken and waste away ( atrophy ) .
About 75 % of people have limb onset ALS .
These patients first have difficulty speaking clearly .
About 25 % of cases are bulbar onset ALS .
In some of these cases , symptoms first affect one of the legs , and patients have awkwardness when walking or running or they notice that they are tripping or stumbling more often .
From 1976 to 1979 , Bryson served as chairman of the California State Water Resources Control Board .
He is the former Chairman , Chief Executive Officer and President of Edison International , the parent company of Southern California Edison .
The Senate confirmed him by a 74-26 vote on October 20 , 2011 .
John E. Bryson ( born July 24 , 1943 ) is an American politician .
He is the 37th Secretary of Commerce .
After graduating from law school , Bryson helped start the Natural Resources Defense Council .
It is one of the most common bat species in the British Isles .
In 1999 the Common Pipistrelle was split into two species on the basis of different-frequency echolocation calls .
The frequencies used by this bat species for echolocation lie between 45-76 kHz , have most energy at 47 kHz and have an average duration of 5.6 ms.
It is common in woodland and farmland but is also found in towns , where it roosts in lofts and buildings .
The Common Pipistrelle uses a call of 45 kHz , while the Soprano Pipistrelle echo-locates at 55 kHz .
The Common Pipistrelle Pipistrellus pipistrellus is a small bat with a very large range across most of Europe , North Africa , southwestern Asia , and possibly into Korea .
Since then other differences , in appearance , habitat and food , have also been found .

Anjuman , a Pakistani Urdu color film , was released on 31 July , 1970 , starring Waheed Murad , Rani , Deeba , Santosh Kumar , Sabiha Khanam and Lehri .
The film was released at the worse political situations of the country .
Nevertheless , the film became a huge success , with famous tracks by Runa Laila .
The film was produced by Safdar Masood and directed by Hassan Tariq , a well-known Pakistani film director .

As a child , her parents took her to their rock concerts and exposed her to a variety of music .
She had to secretly listen to pop music because her parents were against it .
Eventually , her parents began to support her dream to become a singer .
She speaks both Mandarin and Korean , and has released music in both Korea and China .
The song was placed # 1 on Daum 's Music Video chart as well as hitting the highest search number on the famous Korean search engine Naver .
SM Entertainment also released a `` Timeless '' documentary version of her `` Y ( Why ... ) '' PV .
When she was twelve , she went to a middle school founded by the Sichuan Music College after scoring the highest with her violin-playing , but she chose to become a singer instead .
Li Yin liked classical , American and European music so much that she says she never sang children 's songs when she was a child .

Before her official debut , it was already known that her song was a duet with popular TVXQ-member Xiah Junsu , which caused even more excitement and anticipation among the general public .

She started training in 2003 at the age of 13 and for 3 years , she special singing and dance training under SM Entertainment .
Li Yin has been nicknamed the `` Chinese BoA '' .
Foot-and-mouth disease virus causes the disease which can infect domestic animals such as cattle , pigs , sheep , goats and deer .
While the disease is widespread around the world , North America , Central America , Australia , New Zealand , Japan , Chile , and many countries in Europe are considered free of FMD .
However , humans can spread FMD by carrying the virus on their clothes and body .
He also used the same technique on his 1965 song `` If I Needed Someone , '' which shares a similar melodic pattern .
The following day he taped his lead vocals , and he and McCartney recorded their backing vocals twice to give a fuller sound .
`` Here Comes the Sun '' was completed four days later with the addition of Harrison 's Moog synthesizer part .
John Lennon did not contribute to the song as he was recovering from a car crash .
Towards the end of the session , Harrison spent an hour re-recording his acoustic guitar part .
A harmonium and handclaps were added on July 16 .
`` Here Comes the Sun '' is a song by George Harrison from The Beatles ' 1969 album Abbey Road .
Harrison stated in The Beatles Anthology : Harrison , McCartney and Starr recorded the song in 13 takes on July 7 , 1969 .
Harrison capoed his guitar on the 7th fret , resulting the final key of A major .
Petrarch is often popularly called the `` father of humanism '' .
His sonnets were admired and imitated throughout Europe during the Renaissance and became a model for lyrical poetry .
Based on Petrarch 's works , and to a lesser extent those of Dante Alighieri and Giovanni Boccaccio , Pietro Bembo in the 16th century created the model for the modern Italian language .
Francesco Petrarca ( July 20 , 1304 - July 19 , 1374 ) , known in English as Petrarch , was an Italian scholar , poet , and one of the earliest Renaissance humanists .

Its National Olympic Committee was formed in 1933 during the British Mandate of Palestine .
As the team represented the Jewish community , it boycotted the 1936 Games in Germany in protest of the Nazi Party 's anti-Semitic policies .
In 1972 , 11 members of the Israeli delegation were murdered by Black September terrorists .
Israel has been at the Olympic Games as a nation since 1952 .
Israel has sent a team to each Summer Olympic Games since 1952 ( except the 1980 Summer Olympics ) and to each Winter Olympic Games since 1994 .
Virtual memory is the memory management technique which is a recent trend of technology used in computers .
In the 2000s , hip hop music and hip hop culture are very popular in the United States and Canada .
Hip hop music also uses musical styles from pop music such as disco and reggae .
Such contact can also lead to more mundane infections from common bacteria and viruses found in , around and secreted from the genital regions .
If the receiving partner has wounds on their genitals , or if the giving partner has wounds or open sores on or in their mouth , or bleeding gums , this poses an increased risk of STD transmission .
These wounds , even when they are microscopic , increase the chances of contracting STDs that can be transmitted orally under these conditions .
Diseases such as Chlamydia , human papillomavirus ( HPV ) , gonorrhea , herpes , hepatitis ( multiple strains ) , and other sexually transmitted diseases ( STDs ) , as well as viruses such as HIV , can be transmitted through oral sex .
Brushing the teeth , flossing , undergoing dental work , or eating crunchy foods such as potato crisps relatively soon before or after giving fellatio can also increase the risk of transmission , because all of these activities can cause small scratches in the lining of the mouth .
Because of this , some medical professionals advise the use of condoms when performing or receiving fellatio with a partner whose STD status is unknown .
Any kind of direct contact with body fluids of a person infected with HIV , the virus that causes AIDS , poses a risk of infection .
The risk from most of these types of infection , however , is generally considered far lower than that associated with vaginal or anal sex .
Human fertility depends on factors of nutrition , sexual behavior , culture , instinct , endocrinology , timing , economics , way of life , and emotions .
In postmenarchal girls , about 80 % of the cycles are anovulatory in the first year after menarche , 50 % in the third and 10 % in the sixth year .
As a measure , fertility rate is the number of children born per couple , person or population .
This is defined the potential for reproduction ( influenced by gamete production , fertilisation and carrying a pregnancy to term ) .
Sperm count is becoming smaller with age , with men aged 50-80 years producing 75 % of sperm compared with 20-50 years old males .
Fertility is the natural capability to give life .
According to Henri Leridon , PhD , an epidemiologist with the French Institute of Health and Medical Research , of women trying to get pregnant , without using fertility drugs or in vitro fertilization : The use of fertility drugs and\/or in vitro fertilization can increase the chances of becoming pregnant at a later age .
In the United States the average age of menarche ( first period ) is about 12.5 years. , However , in most girls , menarche does not signal that ovulation has occurred .
In 1965 , Hurricane Betsy made landfall just south of New Orleans , causing widespread flooding in the city .
At this point , Katrina was a Category 3 hurricane with 115 mph ( 185 km\/h ) winds and about 335 miles ( 540 km ) to the south-southeast of the Mississippi River 's mouth .
Three days before Katrina 's second and third landfalls , the National Hurricane Center began predicting that the storm would make landfall as a major hurricane .
The committee concluded that the forecasts given by the National Weather Service were timely , were not responsible for failures in other agencies , and were likely responsible for saving thousands of lives .
However , the protection given by this system was limited to hurricanes up to Category 3 intensity on the Saffir-Simpson Hurricane Scale .
As a result , the level of detail was highlighted as an `` innovative best practice '' in the NWS assessment , which recommended issuing warnings with similar levels of detail in the future .
Previous warnings , such as the one made by the Houston Chronicle in 2001 , told of a disaster that `` would strand 250,000 people or more , and probably kill one of 10 left behind as the city drowned under 20 feet of water '' following a severe hurricane making landfall on the city .
As New Orleans is located on the Mississippi River delta and much of the city is below sea level , a strong hurricane could have a devastating effect on the city .
At 11:00 p.m. EDT August 26 , approximately 56 hours before Katrina 's landfall near Buras , Louisiana , the National Hurricane Center had predicted that the New Orleans metropolitan area could face a direct hit by the storm .
The National Hurricane Center 's director , Max Mayfield , mentioned that the Mississippi\/Louisiana area has `` the greatest potential for nightmare scenarios , '' and that this has been known for at least the three decades he has worked at the NHC .
As a result , a system of levees was authorized by Congress to handle future storm events .
The National Weather Service bulletin for the New Orleans region of 10:11 a.m. , August 28 , 2005 was a vividly worded release issued by the local Weather Forecast Office in Slidell , Louisiana warning of the devastation that the Gulf Coast of the United States could experience as a result of Hurricane Katrina .
By the next morning , on August 27 , the NHC gave out a hurricane watch that included the New Orleans metro area , which was upgraded to a hurricane warning by 10:00 p.m. CDT that same evening .
Partly due to this bulletin , people in southeastern Louisiana and southern Mississippi , those most affected by the storm 's impact , followed evacuation orders more closely , resulting in a reduced fatality number .
The report called the bulletin `` a significant moment for the NWS during Katrina , '' as its detailed and specific language did not have any previous precedent ( though the message was based on a template designed by the Tampa Weather Office in 1990 ) .
See also : Meteorological history of Hurricane Katrina On the evening of August 25 , 2005 , Hurricane Katrina made landfall as a Category 1 hurricane near the Miami-Dade - Broward county line in southern Florida and weakened into a tropical storm as a result .
During an internal assessment by the National Weather Service , the 10:11 bulletin and its impact were examined .
Other publications , such as Popular Mechanics , , Scientific American , and The Times-Picayune predicted doomsday situations in which a sinking city would drown and its residents would be left homeless .
At that time , the Weather Forecasting Office in Slidell , Louisiana issued an `` urgent weather message '' describing the destruction Katrina would likely cause in the region : At 10:11 a.m. CDT ( 1511 UTC ) , Robert Ricks , a meteorologist with the New Orleans\/Baton Rouge NWS office , issued the following statement : An equally-explicit bulletin was repeated at 4:13 p.m. CDT .
The next morning , after passing over the state , Tropical Storm Katrina moved into the Gulf of Mexico , strengthened back to hurricane strength , and from the influence of the warm waters from the Loop Current , began undergoing rapid deepening .
That night , the storm underwent another period of rapid strengthening , strengthening to a Category 5 hurricane with maximum sustained winds of 175 mph ( 280 km\/h ) by 10:00 am CDT on August 28 .
In the following months after the storm , Congress appointed a two-party system committee to look into the response to Hurricane Katrina and the preparations before to its landfall .
The strongly-worded statement persuaded people to evacuate , and was highlighted by national news media .
The Rainbow flag has been the symbol of the LGBT ( lesbian , gay , bisexual , and transgender ) community since its creation in 1978 .
Two other Vezina winning goaltenders have also won the Hart Memorial Trophy : Roy Worters and Al Rollins .
Three finalists are named and the trophy is awarded at the NHL Awards ceremony after the playoffs .
The voting is conducted at the end of the regular season by the 30 general managers of the teams in the National Hockey League , and each individual voter ranks their top three candidates on a 5-3-1 points system .
Players for the Montreal Canadiens have won the Vezina 28 times .
Chuck Rayner was the only goaltender to win the Hart Memorial Trophy , but never the Vezina .
Billy Smith of the New York Islanders was the first winner of the Vezina under the current system .
Jacques Plante holds the record for winning the most Vezinas with seven , trailed by Bill Durnan and Dominik Hasek both of who have won six .
The NHL adopted the current criteria for the Vezina Trophy beginning in 1982 .
The William M. Jennings Trophy was created as a new award for the goaltender ( s ) of the team that surrenders the fewest goals in regular season play .
Before 1981 , it was awarded to the goaltender ( s ) of the team allowing the fewest number of goals during the regular season ; now , the William M. Jennings Trophy is awarded under this previous definition .
There are only three players that have won both the Vezina and Hart Memorial Trophy for the same season : Jacques Plante , who won both trophies for the 1961-62 season ; Dominik Hasek who won both for the 1996-97 and 1997-98 seasons ; and Jose Theodore , who won the Vezina and Hart for the 2001-02 NHL season .
In the 1973-74 NHL season , Tony Esposito of the Chicago Black Hawks and Bernie Parent of the Philadelphia Flyers finished tied for the fewest goals against , the only time that there would be a tie between two players from different teams .
Hasek has won the most under the current system of honoring the best individual goalie .
When introduced , the Vezina Trophy was awarded to the goaltender , or goaltenders , of the team that gave up the fewest goals in regular season play .
The Vezina Trophy is awarded every year to the National Hockey League 's goaltender who is chosen as the best goaltender .
Since 1981 , the Vezina Trophy has been awarded by the NHL General Managers to the most outstanding goaltender .
It was first awarded at the end of the 1926-27 NHL season .
However , it was recognized that this system often meant the trophy went to the goaltender of the better team rather than the individual and hence the change was made to offer the William M. Jennings Trophy to the goaltender ( s ) playing for the team with the fewest goals against .
When Vezina died , the trophy was given to the League by the former owners of the Montreal Canadiens , Leo Dandurand , Louis Letourneau and Joe Cattarinich .
All Caliphs of Córdoba were members of the Umayyad dynasty ; the same dynasty had held the title Emir of Córdoba and ruled over roughly the same territory since 756 .
This made it one of the largest unitary states in history and one of the few states to ever extend direct rule over three continents ( Africa , Europe , and Asia ) .
Some supported prominent early Muslims like Al-Zubayr ; others felt that only members of Muhammad 's clan , the Banu Hashim , or his own lineage , the descendants of Ali , should rule .
There were numerous rebellions against the Umayyads , as well as splits within the Umayyad ranks ( notably , the rivalry between Yaman and Qays ) .
This period is known as the Fitna , or the first Islamic civil war .
His successor , Uthman Ibn Affan , was elected by a council of electors ( Majlis ) .
The title Caliph ( خليفة ) was claimed by Abd-ar-Rahman III on January 16 , 929 ; he was previously known as the Emir of Córdoba ( أمير قرطبة ) .
The Caliphate of Córdoba ( خليفة قرطبة ) ruled the Iberian Peninsula from the city of Córdoba , from 929 to 1031 .
Although not ruling all of the Sahara , homage was paid to the Caliph by Saharan Africa usually via various nomad Berber tribes .
In areas which were previously under Persian or Byzantine rule , the Caliphs lowered taxes , provided greater local autonomy , greater religious freedom for Jews , indigenous Christians , and brought peace to peoples that were demoralized and disaffected by the casualties and heavy taxation that resulted from the years of Byzantine-Persian warfare .
Islamic rule expanded westward across North Africa and into Hispania and eastward through Persia and ultimately to Sindh and Punjab in modern day Pakistan .
This period was characterized by remarkable success in technology , trade and culture ; many of the masterpieces of Spain were constructed in this period , including the famous Great Mosque of Córdoba .
Eventually , supporters of the Banu Hisham and the supporters of the lineage of Ali united to bring down the Umayyads in 750 .
Muawiyah , a relative of Uthman , and governor ( Wali ) of Syria became one of Ali 's challengers .
Under the Umayyads the Caliphate grew rapidly geographically .
The caliphate is the only form of governance that has full approval in traditional Islamic theology , and `` is the core political concept of Sunni Islam , by the consensus of the Muslim majority in the early centuries . ''
However , the Shiˤat ˤAlī , `` the Party of Ali '' , were again disappointed when the Abbasid dynasty took power , as the Abbasids were descended from Muhammad 's uncle , ` Abbas ibn ` Abd al-Muttalib and not from Ali .
Uthman was killed by members of an opposition group .
Later the caliphate was won by the Abbasids and Al-Andalus ( or Hispania ) split from the Abbasid Caliph in Baghdad to form their own caliphate .
The rule of the Caliphate is known as the heyday of Muslim presence in the Iberian peninsula , before it split into taifas .
Abu Bakr , the first successor of Muhammad , nominated Umar as his successor on his deathbed , and there was consensus in the Muslim community to his choice .
Largely due to the fact that they were not elected via Shura , the Umayyad dynasty was not universally supported within the Muslim community .
Then Ali took control .
During the Ummayad period Hispania was an integral province of the Ummayad Caliphate ruled from Damascus , Syria .
The way Deinotherium used its curious tusks has been much debated .
It may have rooted in soil for underground plant parts like roots and tubers , pulled down branches to snap them and reach leaves , or stripped soft bark from tree trunks .
Deinotherium fossils have been uncovered at several of the African sites where remains of prehistoric hominid relatives of modern humans have also been found .
Coconut water is the liquid inside young coconuts .
Coconut water is often marketed as a sports drink because of its high potassium and minerals which helps the body recover from exercise .
Coconut water has long been a popular drink in tropical islands especially in tropical Asia , Pacific Islands , and the Caribbean .
It was directed by Ethan Spaulding , Giancarlo Volpe , and Joaquim Dos Santos , and written by Michael Dante DiMartino , Bryan Konietzko , and Aaron Ehasz .
The Saturday airing of Sozin 's Comet acted as a climax to a week of ten new episodes that concluded Avatar 's third season .
The finale focuses on series protagonist Aang 's non-violent personality and his reluctance to kill Fire Lord Ozai .
Sozin 's Comet received positive reception from critics and fans alike .
The finale also follows the exploits of many of Aang 's friends and allies , including Sokka , Toph and Suki 's struggle to destroy a Fire Nation airship armada , Zuko and Katara 's battle against Zuko 's sister Azula , and Iroh , King Bumi , and the Order of the White Lotus ' attempt to reconquer Ba Sing Se .
The initial showing averaged 5.6 million viewers , a 195 % increase in ratings compared with ratings from mid-July 2007 .
During his coronation , Zuko promises to aid the world in the postwar reconstruction .
Aang explains he plans to challenge Fire Lord Ozai only after Sozin 's Comet and its enhancement of Firebending have come and gone , due to his own self-perceived lack of Firebending skills at the moment .
The premiere of episodes 52-61 ( episodes 12-21 of Book 3 : Fire throughout the week of Sozin 's Comet 's release received over 19 million views , of which 5.6 million were from the premiere of Sozin 's Comet .
The Order of the White Lotus liberates Ba Sing Se in the name of the Earth King .
At the 2008 Annie Awards , the director of the third part of Sozin 's Comet ( Episode 20 - Sozin 's Comet , Part 3 : `` Into the Inferno '' ) won an award for `` Best Directing in an Animated Television Production '' .
Though intended to be split into three parts , the finale aired as a two-hour four-part movie on 19 July 2008 .
With the power of his past lives , Aang overwhelms Ozai .
Aang suddenly abandons his Firebending lesson with Zuko to have a beach party with his friends , causing Zuko to attack him in his frustration .
Before she is crowned , Zuko and Katara arrive .
Meanwhile , Aang awakens on a floating island .
When Zuko tells the group Ozai plans to use the comet 's power to burn down the Earth Kingdom , Aang resolves to face him before the comet arrives .
Sometime after the ceremony , Zuko visits Ozai 's prison and demands he tell him the location of the banished Ursa , Zuko 's mother .
In Ba Sing Se , the Order of the White Lotus , led by Iroh , lay siege to the Fire Nation forces within the city , with the sole intention of re-conquering it in the name of the Earth Kingdom .
Meanwhile , Fire Lord Ozai proclaims himself to be ruler of the world , under the title `` Phoenix King '' , and declares Azula to be the new Fire Lord , setting off to burn the world and rebuild it under his New Order .
Prior to the week of 14-19 July , no episodes had been shown since 30 November 2007 .
Meanwhile , Sokka , Toph , and Suki hijack a Fire Nation airship , and use it to destroy many others , effectively stopping Ozai 's plan of incinerating the Earth Kingdom .
Although Ozai is subdued , Aang refuses to kill him ; instead , he locks Ozai down with earth .
A final scene depicts the main cast gathered in Iroh 's new tea shop , the Jasmine Dragon .
Zuko and Katara decide to fight Azula in the Fire Nation capital while Sokka , Toph , and Suki attempt to destroy the airship fleet of Ozai .
Just as Zuko is on the verge of defeating Azula , she shoots a bolt of lightning at Katara instead of Zuko .
The Comet appears in the sky , and Azula 's coronation takes place .
Frustrated with his inability to find a way to defeat Ozai without killing him , he asks four of his past lives for advice .
Sozin 's Comet : The Final Battle is the series finale for the Nickelodeon 's television series Avatar : The Last Airbender .
Zuko accepts Azula 's challenge of an Agni Kai , because he feels that something is wrong with Azula and he does not want Katara injured .
The entire group advises Aang to kill Ozai , but Aang refuses to kill him due to his pacifistic nature and non-violent upbringing .
Zuko intercepts the lightning , preventing Katara from getting hurt , but injures himself after he fails to correctly redirect the lightning .
That night , Aang sleepwalks to a forest not to be found in the morning .
However , when Aang successfully redirects lightning he purposely misses Ozai to avoid killing him .
The lack of a widespread use of the 717 name left it available to rebrand the MD-95 .
Qantas bought more 717s , as well as Hawaiian Airlines and Midwest Airlines .
The ValuJet order was the only order for the MD-95 for two years .
The McDonnell Douglas MD-80 series was finished in 1980 .
The 717 has two Rolls-Royce BR715 turbofan engines .
The last two Boeing 717s were for AirTran and Midwest Airlines .
Nearly 1,200 MD-80s were made from 1980 to 1999 .
This version is made with the BBJ family .
McDonnell Douglas thought that the BMW Rolls-Royce BR700 engine was better than the others , so on February 23 , 1994 , it was chosen to be the plane 's engine .
The 717 was the last airliner made at Boeing 's Long Beach factory in California .
Scandinavian Airlines System ( SAS ) decided to use the Boeing 737-600 instead of the MD-95 in March 1995 .
The Boeing 717 is a jet airliner .
The DC-9 first flew in 1965 .
Halla Group in South Korea was made the wings of the plane , Alenia of Italy made the fuselage , Aerospace Industrial Development Corp. of Taiwan make the tail ; and a part of Korea Air Lines made the nose and cockpit .
The plane was 119 ft 4 in ( 36.37 m ) long and it had a wingspan of 93 ft 5 in ( 28.47 m ) span .
The MD-90 was designed from the MD-80 series .
It can fly for 2,060 nautical miles ( 3,820 kilometres ) .
After Boeing bought McDonnell Douglas in August 1997 , many people thought that Boeing would cancel the MD-95 .
McDonnell Douglas was going to made all MD-95s in China .
Air Canada bought the Embraer E-Jets and Bombardier CRJ instead of the 717 .
McDonnell Douglas said that the MD-95 would not cost much to make , because it was so similar to the MD-90 .
Douglas Aircraft made their DC-9 to fly with the DC-8 in the early 1960s .
However , Boeing decided to keep making it , but call it something else : the Boeing 717 .
The Boeing 717 was designed and sold by McDonnell Douglas .
It also had new IAE V2525-D5 engines .
It first flew in 1993 .
976 DC-9s were made .
Only 117 MD-90s were made .
In early 1994 , the MD-95 was designed by McDonnell Douglas .
McDonnell Douglas said that it thought the MD-95 would become a family of aircraft .
It had two Pratt & Whitney JT8D turbofan engines at the back of the plane and a small wing .
However , in 1994 , McDonnell Douglas began to look for a cheap place to make the planes .
The last 717 was finished in April 2006 for AirTran Airways .
The collection has 44,000 Greek , Roman , and Etruscan antiquities dating from 6,500 BC to 400 AD .
This is available both at the Museum , at various points known as `` GettyGuide stations '' , and externally on its website .
If genuine , the Getty kouros is one of only twelve remaining intact kouroi .
Among the outstanding items is Victorious Youth , one of few life-size Greek bronze statues to have survived to modern times .
The Marbury Hall Zeus is a 81 in ( 2.1 m ) tall marble statue that was recovered from the ruins at Tivoli near Rome .
The Getty Villa is an educational center and museum that covers the arts and cultures of Ancient Greece , Rome , and Etruria .
The Villa also displays the ` Getty kouros ' , which the museum lists as `` Greek , about 530 B.C. , or modern forgery '' because scientific analysis is inconclusive as to whether the marble statue can be dated back to Greek times .
The UCLA\/Getty Master 's Program in Archaeological and Ethnographic Conservation is here .
The collection has 44,000 Greek , Roman , and Etruscan antiquities dating from 6,500 BC to 400 AD .
The Villa also has jewelry and coin collections .
The online GettyGuide as well as through audio tours tell about the items owned by the museum .
The Lansdowne Heracles is a Roman sculpture that was probably copied from an older Greek statue .

At first Stanford wanted to perform another work by Parry : The Glories of Our Blood and State .
Blest Pair of Sirens was first performed by the Bach Choir conducted by Charles Villiers Stanford .

His career in Formula One spanned 15 seasons , with his final two full seasons of top-level racing being spent in the CART series .
Mansell remains the most successful British Formula One driver of all-time in terms of race wins with 31 victories , and is fourth overall on the Formula One race winners list behind Michael Schumacher , Alain Prost , and Ayrton Senna .
Mansell raced in the GP Masters series and signed a one-off race deal for the Scuderia Ecosse GT race team to drive their number 63 Ferrari430 GT2 car at Silverstone on 6 May 2007 .
He was rated in the top 10 Formula One drivers of all time by Murray Walker , who was a Formula One commentator for 50 years .
He is the only person in history to hold both titles simultaneously , and was the first person to win the CART title in his debut season .
Nigel Ernest James Mansell OBE ( born August 8 , 1953 in Upton-upon-Severn , Worcestershire ) is a British racing driver from England who won both the Formula One World Championship ( 1992 ) and CART World Series ( 1993 ) .
In 2008 , American sports television network ESPN ranked him 24th on their top drivers of all-time .
Maxwell 's equations describe how electric charges and electric currents create electric and magnetic fields .
Magnetic fields ` circulate ' around electric currents and time varying electric fields , Ampère 's law with Maxwell 's correction , while electric fields ` circulate ' around time varying magnetic fields , Faraday 's law .
Maxwell 's equations are used in a right-handed coordinate system .
This means that the magnetic field lines must be closed loops .
In a motor or generator , the field circuit has a fixed electric field that causes a magnetic field .

Plinian eruptions have columns of gas and volcanic ash high into the stratosphere .
A Plinian eruption is a kind of volcanic eruption which is similar to that of Mount Vesuvius in the year 79 AD .
These eruptions begin with clouds of volcanic ash and occasionally pyroclastic flows .

Hyssop is used as an ingredient in eau de Cologne and the liqueur Chartreuse .
Hyssop is used as a food plant by the larvae of some Lepidoptera species including Cabbage Moth .
Hyssop is also used , usually in combination with other herbs such as liquorice , in herbal remedies , especially for lung conditions .
Good air circulation is required , such as an airing cupboard with the door left open , or a sunny room , aiming for a temperature of 20-32 ° C. Hyssop leaves should dry out in about six days , any longer and they will begin to discolor and lose their flavor .
Hyssop is also often used to fill the Catholic ceremonial Aspergillum , which the priest dips into a bowl of holy water , and sprinkles onto the congregation to bless them .
Hyssop should be grown in full sun on well-drained soil , and will benefit from occasional clipping .
The dried leaves are stored in clean , dry , airtight containers , and will keep for 12-18 months .
Anise hyssop is native to much of north-central and northern North America .
Hyssop leaves have a slightly bitter minty flavor and can be added to soups , salads or meats , but it should be used sparingly as the flavor is very strong .
They are aromatic , with upright branched stems up to 60 cm long covered with fine hairs at the tips .
Hyssop leaves can be preserved by drying .
Hyssop can also be propagated from cuttings or root division in spring or autumn .
The name ` hyssop ' can be traced back almost unchanged through the Greek word ύσσωπος ( hyssopos ) and Hebrew word אזוב ( ezov ) .
The seeds are planted in spring and the seedlings planted out 40-50 cm apart .
It has also `` been found to improve the yield from grapevines if planted along the rows , particularly if the terrain is rocky or sandy , and the soil is not as easy to work as it might be . ''
It is said to be a good companion plant to cabbage because it will deter the Cabbage White butterfly .
Note that anise hyssop , Agastache foeniculum ( also called blue giant hyssop ) is a very different plant and not a close relation although both are in the mint family .
They should be dried quickly , away from bright sunlight in order to keep their aromatic ingredients and prevent oxidation of other chemicals .
Hyssop ( Hyssopus ) is a genus of about 10-12 species of herbaceous or semi-woody plants in the family Lamiaceae , native from the east Mediterranean to central Asia .
The small blue flowers are on the upper part of the branches during summer .
Hyssop also attracts bees , hoverflies and butterflies , and so has a place in the wild garden as well as being useful in controlling pests and encouraging pollination without the use of unnatural methods .
By far the best-known species is the Herb Hyssop ( H. officinalis ) , widely grown outside its native area in the Mediterranean .
It is good for use as a low hedge or border within an herb garden .
The leaves are narrow ovals , 2-5 cm long .
However , researchers say that the Biblical accounts refer not to the plant currently known as hyssop .
Hyssop is said to be bad for radishes , and they should not be grown nearby .
They should be picked on a dry day at the peak of their maturity and the amount of active ingredients is highest .
It does not live long , and the plants need to be replaced every few years .
It is also used to color the alcohol Absinthe , along with the Melissa plant and Roman wormwood .

On 11 November 1847 Hooker left England for his three year long Himalayan expedition ; he would be the first European to collect plants in the Himalayas .
He was Director of the Royal Botanical Gardens , Kew , for twenty years , in succession to his father , William Jackson Hooker , and was awarded the highest honors of British science .

The ships arrived back in England on 4 September 1843 ; the voyage had been a success for Ross as it was the first to confirm the existence of the southern continent and chart much of its coastline .
The expedition consisted of two ships , HMS Erebus and HMS Terror ; it was the last major voyage of exploration made entirely under sail .

After spending 138 days at sea , and a collision between the Erebus and Terror , they sailed to the Falkland Islands , to Tierra del Fuego , back to the Falklands and onward to their third sortie into the Antarctic .
They visited and collected in Syria and Palestine ; no full-length report was published , but a number of papers were written .
Hooker made plant collections at each location and while traveling drew these and specimens of algae and sea life pulled aboard using tow nets .

This was undertaken with his friend Asa Gray , the leading American botanist of the day .
Hooker was the youngest of the 128 man crew .
Hooker returned to Darjeeling where he spent January and February 1850 writing his journals , replacing specimens lost during his detention and planning a journey for his last year in India .
After spending 5 months in the Antarctic they returned to resupply in Hobart , then went on to Sydney , and New Zealand .
Sir Joseph Dalton Hooker OM GCSI CB MD FRS ( 30 June 1817 - 10 December 1911 ) was a British botanist and explorer of the 19th century .
Hooker was one of the founders of geographical botany , and Charles Darwin 's closest friend .
He sailed on the Erebus and was assistant to the ship 's surgeon , who was instructed to collect zoological and geological specimens .
