The Keel-billed Toucan ( Ramphastos sulfuratus ) , also known as Sulfur-breasted Toucan or Rainbow-billed Toucan , is a colorful Latin American member of the toucan family .
The male and female share in the caring of the eggs , both taking turns incubating .
The Keel-billed Toucan can be found from Southern Mexico to Venezuela and Colombia .
The female Keel-billed Toucan will lay 1-4 white eggs in a natural or already-made tree cavity .
Because toucans spend a large part of time in the trees , this helps the birds to stay on the branches of the trees and hop from one branch to another .
Like many toucans , Keel-billed is a very social bird , rarely seen alone .
When the chicks hatch , they have no feathers , and have their eyes closed for about 3 weeks .
When eating fruit , it uses its bill to take apart the fruit , and then tosses its head back to swallow the fruit whole .
It is the national bird of Belize .
The feathers of the Keel-billed Toucan are mostly black with a yellow neck and chest .
Including its bill , the Keel-billed Toucans ranges in length from around 17 to 22 inches ( 42-55 cm ) .
While the bill seems large and weighty , it is in fact a spongy , hollow bone covered in keratin , a very light and hard protein .
The bill is mostly green with a red tip and orange sides .
The chicks stay in their nest for eight to nine weeks while their bills develop fully .
It travels in small flocks of about six to twelve individuals through lowland rainforests .
The eggs hatch about 15-20 days after being laid .
Keel-billed toucans have two toes that face forward and two that face back .
After hatching , the male and female take turns feeding the chicks .
Keel-billed Toucans eat mostly a wide range of fruit , but may also eat insects , eggs , and reptiles .
Molting happens once per year .
Sexual reassignment surgery ( SRS ) is also called gender reassignment surgery , sex reassignment surgery or a sex change .
It contains two prominent super star clusters with different histories .
It has formed stars at a rate 100 times greater than that of our galaxy during the last 100 million years .
NGC 1569 is a dwarf irregular galaxy in Camelopardalis .
This shows , with the results from other dwarf galaxies such as the Large Magellanic Cloud and NGC 1705 , that star formation in dwarf galaxies does not occur continuously but instead occurs in a series of short bursts .
It contains young stars ( including Wolf-Rayet stars ) which formed less than 5 million years ago ( in NGC 1569 A1 ) as well as older red stars ( in NGC 1569 A2 ) .
In 2008 scientists studying images from Hubble calculated the galaxy 's distance at nearly 11 million light-years away , making it a member of the IC 342 group of galaxies .
The many supernovae produced in the galaxy as well as the strong stellar winds of its stars have produced filaments and bubbles of ionized hydrogen with respective sizes of up to 3,700 and 380 light years .
NGC 1569 's starburst may have been triggered by interactions with other galaxies of the IC 342 group , probably a nearby cloud of hydrogen .
Super star cluster B , near the center of the galaxy , has older red giants and red supergiants .
This faint galaxy is well studied by professional astronomers , who are interested in the history of star formation in the galaxy .
Both of these star clusters have masses similar to the globular clusters in the Milky Way .
They are similar to small globular clusters or R136 in the Large Magellanic Cloud .
The most notable feature of NGC 1569 is its powerful starburst .
The galaxy is relatively nearby , so the Hubble Space Telescope can easily pick out its stars .

A swimming pool is a tank or large basin that is filled with water and intended for recreational or competitive swimming or diving .

WWE Hell in a Cell is a professional wrestling event produced every year by WWE , a Connecticut-based professional wrestling promotion , and broadcast live only on pay-per-view ( PPV ) .
Under the former Brand Extension , WWE assigned its performers to either Raw or SmackDown , which in the 2009 and 2010 events caused matches to be set up between wrestlers on the same show .
Since it began , the event has been held only in indoor arenas in the United States .
`` Hell in a Cell '' was chosen over `` No Escape '' , `` Locked Up '' and `` Rage in a Cage '' .
The show 's concept is based on WWE 's well-known Hell in a Cell match , in which wrestlers fight inside a 20-foot ( 6-metre ) high roofed cell structure surrounding the ring and ringside area .
The event began in 2009 , replacing No Mercy in the early October slot of WWE 's PPV calendar .
Championship bouts are scheduled on every card .
In this PPV , all main events are fought as Hell in a Cell matches , in which the ring and ringside area are surrounded by a 20-foot high roofed cell structure .
Each main event match of the card is contested as a Hell in a Cell match .

Evidence as to Man 's Place in Nature is an 1863 book by Thomas Henry Huxley , in which he gives evidence for the evolution of man and apes from a common ancestor .
In the 18th century Linnaeus and others had classified man as a primate , but without drawing evolutionary conclusions .
It was the first book devoted to the topic of human evolution , and discussed much of the anatomical and other evidence .
This chapter and its addendum contained most of the controversial material , and is still important today .
I. On the natural history of the man-like Apes p1-56 .
The book came five years after Charles Darwin and Alfred Russel Wallace announced their theory of evolution by means of natural selection , and four years after the publication of Darwin 's Origin of Species .
This contains a summary of what was known of the great apes at that time .
Huxley compares these remains with existing human races .
It was Lamarck , the first to develop a coherent theory of evolution , who discussed human evolution in this context .
In the Origin Darwin had deliberately avoided tackling human evolution , except for a sentence : `` Light will be thrown on the origin of man and his history '' .
Backed by this evidence , the book said that evolution applied as fully to man as to all other life .
Addendum : A succinct history of the controversy respecting the cerebral structure of Man and the apes p113-118 .
The Importance of being Earnest , A Trivial Comedy for Serious People is a play by Oscar Wilde .
The successful opening night marked the climax of Wilde 's career but also heralded his downfall .
Wilde was tipped off , and Queensberry was refused admission .
Soon afterwards the feud came to a climax in court , and Wilde 's new notoriety caused the play , despite its success , to be closed after just 86 performances .
After imprisonment , he wrote no further comic or dramatic work .
The production was released on audio cassette by the BBC Radio Collection ( ISBN 0-563-47803-9 ) .
The Marquess of Queensberry , father of Lord Alfred Douglas , Wilde 's lover , planned to present Wilde a bouquet of spoiling vegetables and disrupt the show .
In 1963 , Erik Chisholm made an opera from the play .
Later in a letter he said that the play was `` extremely funny '' but `` really heartless '' .
The Importance of Being Earnest has been revived many times since its premiere and adapted for the cinema on three occasions , in 1952 , 1992 and 2002 .
George Bernard Shaw , for example , reviewed the play in the Saturday Review .

The peppercorns can also be lightly fried in order to make a spicy oil with various uses .
From 1968 to 2005 , the United States Food and Drug Administration banned the importation of Sichuan peppercorns because they were found to be capable of carrying citrus canker ( as the tree is in the same family , Rutaceae , as the genus Citrus ) .
The preferred recipe includes ginger oil and brown sugar to be cooked with a base of noodles and vegetables , with rice vinegar and Sichuan pepper oil to be added after cooking .
The import ban was only loosely enforced until 2002 .
Hua jiao yan is a mixture of salt and Sichuan pepper , roasted and browned in a wok and served as a condiment to accompany chicken , duck and pork dishes .
In this form it is best used in stir fry noodle dishes without hot spices .
One Himalayan specialty is the momo , a dumpling stuffed with vegetables , cottage cheese or minced yak meat , beef or pork and flavored with Sichuan pepper , garlic , ginger and onion .
In 2005 , the USDA and FDA lifted the ban , provided the peppercorns are heated to around 70 degrees Celsius ( 160 degrees Fahrenheit ) to kill the canker bacteria before importation .
It is also available as an oil ( marketed as either `` Sichuan pepper oil '' or `` Hwajiaw oil '' ) .
Sichuan pepper has a unique aroma and taste .
Star anise and ginger are often used with it .
Sichuan pepper is one of the few spices which are important for Tibetan and Bhutanese cookery of the Himalayas .
Tibetans believe it can sanitize meat that may not be so fresh .
Ma la ( Chinese : 麻辣 ; pinyin : málà ; literally `` numb and hot '' ) , a flavor common in Sichuan cooking , is a combination of Sichuan pepper and chili pepper .
Although the plants are called peppers , they are not related to either black pepper or Chili pepper .
The noodles are steamed and served dry , together with a fiery sauce .

The Division of Parramatta is an Australian Electoral Division in New South Wales .
The division is in the western suburbs of Sydney .
The name Parramatta is an Aboriginal word for `` the place where the eels lie down '' .
The division was created in 1900 for the first federal election in 1901 .
There are three main classifications of anaphylaxis .
There is also an immunologic mechanism that does not rely on IgE , but it is not known if this occurs in humans .
A multi-year course of subcutaneous desensitization has been found effective against stinging insects , while oral desensitization is effective for many foods .
Blood tests for specific antibodies can be useful to confirm milk , egg , peanut , tree nut and fish allergies .
Hoarseness , pain with swallowing , or a cough may also occur .
Skin allergy tests ( such as patch tests ) are available for certain foods and venoms .
The term comes from the Greek words ἀνά ana , against , and φύλαξις phylaxis , protection .
The most common are β-lactam antibiotics ( such as penicillin ) followed by aspirin and NSAIDs .
If someone has a reaction to penicillins , their risk of a reaction to cephalosporins is greater , but the risk is still less than one in 1000 .
Anaphylaxis to aspirin and NSAIDs occurs in about one in every 50,000 people .
Anaphylaxis typically has a number of symptoms including an itchy rash , throat swelling , and low blood pressure .
Newer , lower osmolar radiocontrast agents cause reactions in 0.04 % of cases .
Anaphylaxis to penicillins or cephalosporins only occurs after they bind to proteins inside the body , and some bind more easily than others .
Symptoms from the stomach and intestines may include crampy abdominal pain , diarrhea , and vomiting ( throwing up ) .
Children can outgrow their allergies .
Epinephrine ( adrenaline ) is the primary treatment for anaphylaxis .
In rare cases , very low blood pressure may be the only sign of anaphylaxis .
In this situation , if epinephrine is not effective , intravenous glucagon can be administered .
Methylene blue has been used in those not responsive to other measures because it may relax smooth muscle .
People with atopic diseases such as asthma , eczema , or allergic rhinitis have a high risk of anaphylaxis from food , latex , and radiocontrast agents .
Venom from stinging or biting insects such as bees and wasps ( Hymenoptera ) or kissing bugs ( Triatominae ) may cause anaphylaxis .
Anaphylaxis is a serious allergic reaction that begins suddenly and may cause death .
Minor problems from epinephrine include tremors , anxiety , headaches , and palpitations .
One study in children with anaphylaxis found that 60 % had a history of previous atopic diseases .
The combination of IgE bound to the antigen activates FcεRI receptors on mast cells and basophils .
These mediators increase the contraction of bronchial smooth muscles , cause blood vessels to widen ( vasodilation ) , increase the leakage of fluid from blood vessels , and depress the actions of the heart muscle .
The action plan usually includes use of epinephrine auto-injectors , the recommendation to wear a medical alert bracelet , and counseling on how to avoid triggers .
Worldwide , about 0.05-2 % of people have anaphylaxis at some point in their lives .
A second dose is needed in 16 to 35 % of cases .
Common causes include insect bites , foods , and medications .
Other features may include a runny nose and swelling of the mucous membrane on the surface of the eye and eyelid ( conjunctiva ) .
Skin tests can confirm penicillin allergies , but there are no skin tests for other medications .
Widening of blood vessels around the brain may cause headaches .
Anaphylaxis to penicillin occurs once in every 2,000 to 10,000 people who are treated .
( The combination of a slow heart rate and low blood pressure is known as Bezold-Jarisch reflex ) .
Respiratory symptoms and signs include shortness of breath , low-pitched difficult breathing ( wheezes ) , or high-pitched difficult breathing ( stridor ) .
The tongue or throat may swell in up to 20 % of cases .
Pseudoanaphylaxis or anaphylactoid reactions are older names for anaphylaxis that is not due to an allergic reaction , but is due to direct injury to mast cells ( mast cell degranulation ) .
Agents that can damage these cells include contrast medium for X-rays , opioids , temperature ( hot or cold ) , and vibration .
Anaphylactic shock happens when blood vessels get wider throughout most of the body ( systemic vasodilation ) , which causes low blood pressure that is at least 30 % lower than the person 's normal blood pressure or 30 % below standard values .
Intravenous epinephrine , however , has been linked to irregular heartbeats ( dysrhythmia ) and heart attacks ( myocardial infarction ) .
It can sometimes be difficult to distinguish anaphylaxis from asthma , fainting due to lack of oxygen ( syncopy ) , and panic attacks .
This type of therapy may prevent future episodes of anaphylaxis .
The second reaction is treated in the same way as the original anaphylaxis .
Parents should inform schools of their children 's allergies and what to do in case of an anaphylactic emergency .
They may be used in the hope of decreasing the risk of biphasic anaphylaxis , but their effectiveness in preventing future anaphylaxis is uncertain .
The injection may be repeated every 5 to 15 minutes if the person is not responding well to the treatment .
The current name used by the World Allergy Organization is `` non-immune anaphylaxis '' .
By age 16 , 80 % of children with anaphylaxis to milk or eggs and 20 % with a single case of anaphylaxis to peanuts are able to eat these foods without problems .
When anaphylaxis is caused by an immune response , immunoglobulin E ( IgE ) binds to the foreign material that starts the allergic reaction ( the antigen ) .
The skin may also have a blue color ( cyanosis ) due to a lack of oxygen .
The mast cells and basophils react by releasing inflammatory mediators such as histamine .
It is recommended that an epinephrine solution be injected into the muscle of the mid anterolateral thigh as soon as anaphylaxis is suspected .
When anaphylaxis is not caused by in immune response , the reaction is due to an agent that directly damages mast cells and basophils , causing them to release histamine and other substances that are usually associated with an allergic reaction ( degranulation ) .
A 2007 Cochrane review did not find any good-quality studies that could be used to recommend them .
Allergy testing may help to determine what caused a person 's anaphylaxis .
In Western cultures , the most common causes are eating or being in contact with peanuts , wheat , tree nuts , shellfish , fish , milk , and eggs .
The most common areas affected include : skin ( 80-90 % ) , lungs and breathing pathways ( 70 % ) , stomach and intestines ( 30-45 % ) , heart and blood vessels ( 10-45 % ) , and central nervous system ( 10-15 % ) .
In Asia , rice and chickpeas often cause anaphylaxis .
People who already have heart disease are at greater risk of cardiac affects from anaphylaxis .
Low-pitched breathing is typically due to spasms of the muscles in the lower part of the airway ( bronchial muscles ) .
Anaphylaxis is due to the release of mediator proteins from certain types of white blood cells .
Epinephrine autoinjectors , which allow people with anaphylaxis to inject epinephrine into a muscle themselves , are typically available in two doses , one for adults or children who weight more than 25 kg and one for children who weight 10 to 25 kg .
Many foods can trigger anaphylaxis , even when the food is eaten for the first time .
The symptoms return they typically return within 8 hours .
Any medication may cause anaphylaxis .
Anaphylaxis typically produces many different symptoms over minutes or hours .

There is some evidence that the Pictish language may have had close ties to Common Brittonic and might be a fifth branch .
Common Brittonic ( also called Common Brythonic , British , Old Brythonic , or Old Brittonic ) was an ancient language spoken in Britain .
By the 6th century it split into several Brittonic languages : Welsh , Cumbric , Cornish , and Breton .
Common Brittonic survived into the Middle Ages in Southern Scotland and Cumbria .
South of the Firth of Forth it was replaced by Old English ( which later developed into Scots ) .
Evidence from Welsh shows a great influence from Latin on Common Brittonic during the Roman period .
Common Brittonic is descended from Proto-Celtic , a hypothetical parent language .
Common Brittonic was gradually replaced by English throughout England .
They have fangs connected to secretory glands ; it is still unknown whether these glands secrete digestive juices or poisonous venom , or whether remipedes feed primarily on detritus or on living organisms .
They have a primitive body plan in crustacean terms , and may be a basal , ancestral crustacean group .
They are generally slow-moving .
The swimming appendages are on the sides of each segment , and the animals swim on their backs .
At least one species , Godzilliognomus frondosus , has an organised brain , with a particularly large olfactory area .
They are found in almost every ocean basin so far explored , including in Australia , the Caribbean Sea , the Atlantic Ocean .
Remipedes are 10-40 millimetres ( 0.4-1 .6 in ) long .
The first described remipede was a fossil called Tesnusocaris goldichi ( early Pennsylvanian ) .
The symbolist painters used mythological and dream imagery .
The works of Edgar Allan Poe , which Baudelaire admired greatly and translated into French , were a significant influence and the source of many stock tropes and images .
Symbolists believed that art should represent absolute truths that could only be described indirectly .
Auguste Rodin is sometimes considered a symbolist sculptor .
More a philosophy than an actual style of art , symbolism in painting influenced the contemporary Art Nouveau style and Les Nabis .
The symbols used by symbolism are not the familiar emblems of mainstream iconography but intensely personal , private , obscure and ambiguous references .
Symbolism was a late 19th-century art movement of French , Russian and Belgian origin .
In literature , the style started with the publication Les Fleurs du mal ( The Flowers of Evil , 1857 ) by Charles Baudelaire .
There were several groups of Symbolist painters and visual artists , including Gustave Moreau , Gustav Klimt , Odilon Redon , Henri Fantin-Latour , Gaston Bussière , Edvard Munch , Félicien Rops , and Jan Toorop .
Its ideas affected Mikhail Vrubel , Nicholas Roerich , Martiros Saryan , Mikhail Nesterov , Léon Bakst , Elena Gorokhova in Russia , as well as Frida Kahlo in Mexico and David Chetlahe Paladin in the United States .
The name `` symbolist '' itself was first used by the critic Jean Moréas , who invented it to distinguish the symbolists from similar styles of literature and art .
Symbolism in art is related to the gothic component of Romanticism .

The unpopularity of Tinoco 's government led to a considerable decline in the size , wealth , and political influence of the Costa Rican military .

Since then , Costa Rica has held 13 presidential elections , the latest in 2010 .

With more than 2,000 dead , the 44-day Costa Rican Civil War was the bloodiest event in Costa Rica during the 20th century .

Costa Rica never fought for independence from Spain .
Costa Rica was called `` the poorest and most miserable Spanish colony in all America '' by a Spanish governor in 1719 .
Coffee was first planted in Costa Rica in the early 19th century .
Costa Rica has enjoyed greater peace and political stability than other Latin American nations .
Costa Rica 's distance from the capital in Guatemala , its legal prohibition to trade with the Viceroyalty of New Granada , and the lack of gold and silver made Costa Rica into a poor , little populated region of the Spanish Empire .
In exchange for making the railroad , Costa Rican gave Keith large amounts of land and a lease on the train route , which he used to produce bananas and export them to the United States .
For all these reasons , Costa Rica was unappreciated and forgotten by the Spanish Crown .

The Rhynie chert contains exceptionally preserved plant , fungus , lichen and animal material preserved in place by an overlying volcanic deposit .
The bulk of the fossil bed consists of primitive plants ( which had water-conducting cells and sporangia , but no true leaves ) , along with arthropods , lichens , algae and fungi .
Second , these cherts are famous for their exceptional state of preservation , with individual cell walls easily visible in polished specimens .

The chert is exposed near the village of Rhynie , Aberdeenshire , Scotland .

Oppidum ( plural oppida ) is a Latin word for the main settlement in any administrative area of ancient Rome .
Many oppida grew from hill forts , but not all of them had an important defensive role .
They were the first large settlements north of the Mediterranean that could be described as towns .

All these lakes are drained , however , either through manmade canals or via karstic phenomena .

It was first presented to the playoff champion of the NHL ( replacing the O'Brien Trophy ) who then went on to face the Western Hockey League ( WHL ) champion for the Stanley Cup .
However , a traditional superstition that is prevalent among many of today 's NHL players is that no player should either touch or hoist the Wales Trophy ( or the Western Conference 's trophy , the Clarence S. Campbell Bowl ) when they have won the conference playoffs as the Eastern Conference champions .
The trophy was first established in the 1923-24 NHL season , for the champion of the NHL playoffs , but it has been the trophy for eight different accomplishments , which also include being the NHL regular season champions , American Division regular season champions , regular season champions , East Division regular season champions , Wales Conference regular season champions , Wales Conference playoffs champions , and Eastern Conference playoffs champions .
The Prince of Wales Trophy , or simply the Wales Trophy , is a National Hockey League ( NHL ) trophy awarded to the Eastern Conference ( formerly the Wales Conference ) playoff champions .
Starting with the 1981-82 campaign , when the league changed its playoff format so that the two teams meeting in the Stanley Cup finals could no longer come from the same conference , the trophy was presented to the Wales Conference playoff champions , and since the 1993-94 season , the Eastern Conference playoff champions have won the award .
After the WHL folded and the Stanley Cup was awarded only to the NHL playoff champion , the Prince of Wales Trophy was awarded to the regular season champion .
The current holder of the Prince of Wales Trophy is the Boston Bruins after defeating the Tampa Bay Lightning in the 2011 Eastern Conference finals .
With the Modern Era expansion in the 1967-68 season and the creation of the West Division , the Wales Trophy was awarded to the team that finished in first place in the East Division during the regular season .
From 1927-28 onwards it was awarded to the champion of the NHL American Division while the O'Brien Trophy was awarded to the NHL Canadian Division .
Seven teams each played 48 games .
The 1940-41 NHL season was the 24th season of the National Hockey League .
The Boston Bruins were the Stanley Cup winners as they beat the Detroit Red Wings four games to none in the final series .

Sebastian Newbold Coe , Baron Coe , KBE ( born 29 September 1956 , and often nicknamed `` Seb Coe '' ) is a former athlete and politician from the United Kingdom .
In December 2005 , Coe was given a Special award at the BBC Sports Personality of the Year awards ceremony .
After the International Olympic Committee awarded the games to London , he became the chairman of the London Organising Committee for the Olympic Games .
A middle distance runner , Coe won the 1500 m gold medal at the Olympic Games in 1980 and 1984 , and set eight outdoor and three indoor world records .
Following his retirement from athletics , he served as a Member of Parliament for the Conservative Party from 1992-97 .
These two lines : Weimar and Gotha ( - Altenburg ) form the basis of future Ernestine lines , and both have surviving male lineage up to today .
In 1596 the brothers agreed to split the duchy into Saxe-Coburg and Saxe-Eisenach .
Johann II , Duke of Saxe-Weimar ( or John II ) , died young but left eight surviving sons who ruled together , Three died , ( including Bernhard of Saxe-Weimar , the youngest , the famed general ) and a will ordering them to rule jointly .
John Frederick III of Gotha died unmarried and heirless in 1565 and John William of Weimar tried to claim Saxe-Gotha , but the sons of the imprisoned John Frederick II entered their own claim .
The other Ernestine duchies were never members of the Imperial Circle , and were subordinate to the five duchies that did belong to the Imperial Circle ( for example , the principalities of Meiningen and Hildburghausen were such ; that was one reason why Duke of Hildburghausen exchanged his patrimony to that of Altenburg ) .
All of the Ernestine Duchies ended with the abolition of the monarchy and princely states in Germany shortly after the end of World War I. Five rulers of the Ernestine duchies had a vote in the Holy Roman Empire 's Reichstag .
When duke of Saxe-Wittenberg died without an heir in 1422 , the Emperor Sigismund gave the duchy to Frederick IV of the House of Wettin .
After the division of the first Altenburg lands line , the senior Ernestine branch ( the Saxe-Weimar family ) , line held just under half of the Ernestine lands , and the junior , Gotha-Altenburg , line held more than half .
The older son of John Frederick II , and John Ernest ( d 1638 heirless ) , the younger son of John Frederick II , received together the territory of Saxe-Coburg-Eisenach .
The Ernestine duchies , are sometimes called the Saxon duchies , were a changing number of small states in the present German state of Thuringia , governed by dukes of the Ernestine line of the house of Wettin The Albertine duchies of Weissenfels , Merseburg and Zeitz were are also sometime called `` Saxon duchies '' and border several Ernestine ones ) The old Duchy of Saxon began to split up in the 15th Century , because law said that all sons should inherit .
Then Ernest took northern Meißen , southern Thuringia , and Wittenberg , with Albert receiving northern Thuringia and southern Meißen Elector Ernest died in 1486 , and was succeeded by his son , Frederick III , the Wise .
The University of Wittenberg was were Martin Luther posted his 95 Theses .
Elisabeth Sophie 's cousin Frederick William III , Duke of Altenburg , died unmarried 1672 .
In 1792 the Duke of Saxe-Weimar was also the Duke of Saxe-Eisenach , and the Duke of Saxe-Altenburg was also the Duke of Saxe-Gotha , so both had two votes ; and the Duke of Saxe-Coburg had one vote .
John Frederick II set up his capitals in in Eisenach and Coburg , the middle brother John William staying in Weimar ( Saxe-Weimar ) , and the youngest , John Frederick III took Gotha ( Saxe-Gotha ) .
Albert , grandson of Albert `` the Bear '' inherited the Duchy of Saxony from his father .
Some of the Ernestine duchies stayed independent until 1918 .
Duke Ernest of Gotha and Duchess Elisabeth Sophie 's numerous sons divided the inheritance into seven parts : Gotha-Altenburg , Coburg , Meiningen , Römhild , Eisenberg , Hildburghausen and Saalfeld .
Frederick protected Luther , and did not send him to Rome for trial .
The nearby royal houses of Reuss and Schwarzburg also divided up their territory , so Thuringia was a tangle of little states , exclaves and enclaves from the late 15th Century until the early 20th Century .
Frederick allowed Lutheran reforms in his country .
Albert 's sons divided Saxony into the duchies of Saxe-Lauenburg and Saxe-Wittenberg .
All of the sons of a Saxon duke had the title of Duke , sometimes brothers ruled the territory together , and sometimes they divided it up between them .
Eventually , primogeniture ( that is , only the eldest son inherits ) became the rule for inheritance in the Ernestine Duchies .
This treaty said John William of Saxe-Weimar would also take the districts of Altenburg , Gotha and Meiningen .
William kept Weimar , Albert became Duke of Eisenach and Ernest `` the Pious '' became known as Duke of Gotha .
The new dukes of Coburg , Römhild and Eisenberg had no children , so their lands were quickly absorbed by the four remaining lines .

In the 11th century , William the Conqueror brought the Talbot hound to Britain .
The Beagle is a breed of small to medium-sized dog .
Elizabeth I called the dogs her singing beagles and often entertained guests at her royal table by letting her Pocket Beagles cavort amid their plates and cups .
Snoopy of the comic strip Peanuts has been picked as `` the world 's most famous beagle '' .
Also , Queen Elizabeth I kept a breed known as a Pocket Beagle , which stood 8 to 9 inches ( 20 to 23 centimetres ) at the shoulder .
It was named so because it could fit in a `` pocket '' or saddlebag , when they rode along on the hunt .
From medieval times , beagle was used as a general description for small hounds , even though they are actually very different from the modern breed .
Once , English Talbots were crossed with Greyhounds to make them faster in running .
Dogs that look almost the same as the modern Beagle can be traced in Ancient Greece back to around the 5th century BC .
In George Jesse 's Researches into the History of the British Dog from 1866 , Gervase Markham is quoted referring to the Beagle as small enough to sit on a man 's hand and to the :
In the Treatise on Hunting or Cynegeticus , written by Xenophon , who said there was a hound that hunted hares by scent and was followed by foot .
Beagles are mostly developed for hunting and finding hare , rabbit , and other kinds of game .
It is a Hound , and it has short legs and long , soft ears .
Beagles can have coats of different colors .

Beagles have been included in popular culture since the times when Queen Elizabeth began to rule , in literature and paintings , and more recently in movie , television and comic books .
Small hounds were mentioned in the Forest Laws .
Although beagle-type dogs have existed for over 2,000 years , the modern kind came from Great Britain around the 1830s .

The Secretary of War was a member of the United States President 's Cabinet , beginning with George Washington 's administration .
A similar position , called either `` Secretary at War '' or `` Secretary of War , '' was appointed to serve the Congress of the Confederation under the Articles of Confederation between 1781 and 1789 .
When Washington was inaugurated as the first president under the Constitution , he appointed Knox to continue serving .
At first , he was responsible for all military affairs .
The Secretary of War led the War Department .
The Secretary of War was replaced by the Secretary of the Army and the Secretary of the Air Force , non-Cabinet positions under the Secretary of Defense .
In 1798 , the Secretary of the Navy was added to the cabinet , and the scope of this office was reduced to a general concern with the Army .
In traditional terms , the role of the conservator involves the examination , conservation , and preservation of cultural heritage using `` any methods that prove effective in keeping that property in as close to its original condition as possible for as long as possible . ''
All of this work is supported by research and education .
Conservation activities include examination , documentation , treatment , protection .

It was found by Johann Palisa on February 25 , 1892 in Vienna , making it one of the last big ( diameter over 200 km ) asteroids found .
It has an unusually long rotation period among the big asteroids .
Its high eccentricity ( for comparison 36 % higher than that of Pluto ) , though , means that at most oppositions other asteroids reach higher magnitudes .
At such an opposition Bamberga can in fact be closer to Earth than any main belt asteroid with magnitude above +9.5 , getting as close as 0.78 AU .
Although its very high orbital eccentricity means its opposition magnitude varies a lot , at a rare opposition near perihelion Bamberga can reach a magnitude of +8.0 , which is as bright as Saturn 's moon Titan .
For comparison , 7 Iris never comes closer than 0.85 AU and 4 Vesta never closer than 1.13 AU when it becomes visible to the naked eye in a pollution-free sky .
Overall Bamberga is the tenth brightest main belt asteroid after , in order , Vesta , Pallas , Ceres , Iris , Hebe , Juno , Melpomene , Eunomia and Flora .
Its brightness at these rare near-perihelion oppositions makes Bamberga the brightest C-type asteroid , about one magnitude brighter than 10 Hygiea 's maximum brightness of around +9.1 .
Apart from the near-earth asteroid Eros , it was the last asteroid which is ever easily visible with binoculars to be found .
An occultation of Bamberga was seen on 8 December , 1987 , and gave a diameter of about 228 km , in agreement with IRAS results .
Its spectral class is between the C-type and P-type asteroids .
324 Bamberga is the 16th biggest asteroid in the Main asteroid belt .
Such near-perihelion oppositions happen on a regular cycle every twenty-two years , with the last happening in 1991 and the next in 2013 .

He was a well known member of the Democratic Party .

When writing in E major , clarinets in A should be used instead of clarinets in B-flat to make it easier to play .
Its relative minor is C-sharp minor .
E major is a major scale with a base note of E. Its key signature has four sharps .
E major is hard for wind instruments to play .

St Pancras is owned by London and Continental Railways along with the adjacent urban regeneration area known as King 's Cross Central .
When the station opened , the arched train shed was the largest single-span roof in the world .
A secure terminal area was constructed for Eurostar services to Continental Europe-via High Speed 1 and the Channel Tunnel-along with platforms for domestic connections to the north and south-east of England .
The restored station houses fifteen platforms , a shopping center and a bus station , in addition to London Underground services from King 's Cross St. Pancras tube station .
It was opened in 1868 by the Midland Railway as its southern terminus .
After escaping planned demolition in the 1960s , the complex was renovated and expanded during the 2000s at a cost of # 800 million .
St Pancras station , also known since 2007 as St Pancras International , is a central London railway terminus celebrated for its Victorian architecture .
The Grade I listed building stands on Euston Road between the British Library , King 's Cross station and the Regent 's Canal .
In the street , Constable Woodhams ran to help Bentley , but was himself wounded by one of the gang firing from the cover of the house , as was Sergeant Tucker , who died almost instantly .
Constable Choate and Sergeant Bentley died in separate hospitals the same day .
The gang 's leader , George Gardstein , opened the door , but when he did not answer their questions they assumed he did not understand English and told him to fetch someone who did .
Growing impatient , the two sergeants entered the house to find the room apparently empty , before they became aware of a man standing in the darkness at the top of the stairs .
Gardstein left the door half-closed and disappeared .
The gang then attempted to break out of the cul-de-sac , Gardstein being grabbed by Constable Choate almost at the entrance .
In the struggle Choate was wounded several times by Gardstein , before being shot five more times by other members of the gang , who also managed to hit Gardstein in the back .
After a short conversation , another man entered through the yard door , rapidly firing a pistol , while the man on the stairs also started shooting .
Instead , the remains of two members of the gang , Fritz Svaars and William Sokolow ( both were also known by numerous aliases ) , were later discovered inside the building .
No sign of Peter the Painter was found .
Both officers were hit , with Bentley collapsing across the doorstep , while Bryant managed to stagger outside .
They then dragged Gardstein 3\/4 of a mile to 59 Grove Street , where he died the next day .
When the fire brigade arrived , Churchill refused them access to the building .
The defenders , though heavily outnumbered , had better gunss and great stores of ammunition .
The police stood ready , guns aimed at the front door , waiting for the men inside to attempt their escape .
Six hours into the battle , and just as the field artillery piece that Churchill had authorised arrived , a fire began in the building .
An intense search followed , and a number of the gang or their associates were soon arrested .
Churchill authorised calling in a detachment of Scots Guards to assist the police .
Besides the three policemen , a London firefighter also died of his injuries .
The door never opened .
The house had a single ground-floor room , into which the front door directly opened , with a staircase leading to the upper floors on the left , and a door to the open yard at the back on the right .
The Siege of Sidney Street , or the `` Battle of Stepney '' , was a notorious gunfight in London 's East End on 3 January 1911 .
On 2 January 1911 , an informer told police that two or three members of the gang , possibly including Peter the Painter , were hiding at 100 Sidney Street , Stepney .
The Tower of London was called for backup , and word got to the Home Secretary , Winston Churchill .
On 16 December 1910 , a gang of Jewish immigrants attempted to break into the rear of a jeweller 's shop at 119 Houndsditch .
Sergeants Bentley and Bryant knocked at the door of No. 11 Exchange Buildings , behind the jeweller 's shop .
Nine unarmed officers - three sergeants and six constables ( two in plain clothes ) - moved towards the jewellers .
There was frequent speculation that Wregget would take over as the starting goaltender .
In 1983 , he joined the St. Catharines Saints , the Toronto AHL affiliate , after being drafted by the Toronto Maple Leafs in the third round of the 1982 NHL Entry Draft , 45th overall .
Wregget played for three seasons with the Lethbridge Broncos of the Western Hockey League and won the Del Wilson Trophy as the WHL 's top goaltender in 1984 .
He played for the Toronto Maple Leafs , Philadelphia Flyers , Pittsburgh Penguins , Calgary Flames , and Detroit Red Wings of the National Hockey League from 1983 through 2000 .
The 1986-87 season was his first full year in the NHL .
In 1992 , he was traded from the Philadelphia Flyers to the reigning champion Pittsburgh Penguins along with Kjell Samuelsson and Rick Tocchet in exchange for Mark Recchi .
He stopped Washington Capitals star Joé Juneau , extending what was the third-longest game in NHL history , the longest game since 1936 .
Wregget was generally backup to Penguins goaltender Tom Barrasso , although Wregget was regarded as a solid goaltender in his own right .
Wregget 's best season came in 1994-95 when he played in 38 games and compiled a 25-9-2 record with a 3.21 goals against average and a .903 save percentage while also leading the NHL in wins .
The Penguins finally won 3-2 in the fourth overtime period .
He won the Stanley Cup in 1992 with the Pittsburgh Penguins .
He played one season for the Manitoba Moose of the International Hockey League in 2000-2001 before retiring at the age of 37 .
Kenneth Wregget ( born March 25 , 1964 ) is a retired Canadian professional ice hockey goaltender .
He split time for two seasons between St. Catharines and the Maple Leafs .
In 2009 , he was inducted into the Manitoba Hockey Hall of Fame .
He was also the goaltender who faced the first penalty shot ever awarded during an overtime period in NHL playoff history ( 1996 ) .
These territories were to be incorporated into the two Bulgarian autonomous provinces as follows : The Great Powers elaborated in detail the constitutional , legislative , executive , defense and law enforcement arrangements , cantonal administrative system , taxation , international supervision etc. for the proposed autonomous provinces .
The Great Powers were represented at the conference respectively by : Lord Salisbury and Sir Henry Elliot ; Count Nikolay Ignatyev ( historical spelling Nicolai Ignatieff ) ; Count Jean-Baptiste de Chaudordy and Count François de Bourgoing ; Baron Karl von Werther ; Baron Heinrich von Calice and Count Ferenc Zichy ; Count Luigi ( Lodovico ) Corti .
The US Consul General in Constantinople , Eugene Schuyler also took an active part in drafting the conference decisions .
Of these , Lord Salisbury , Count de Chaudordy and Baron von Calice were Ambassadors Plenipotentiary to the conference , while Count Ignatyev , Sir Henry Elliot , Count de Bourgoing , Baron von Werther , Count Zichy and Count Corti were the resident Ambassadors of their countries in Constantinople .
Lord Salisbury and Count Ignatyev played a leading role in the process .
The Great Powers agreed on a substantial Bulgarian autonomy to take the form of two new Ottoman provinces ( vilayets ) established for the purpose : Eastern , with capital Tarnovo , and Western , with capital Sofia .
On his part , Salisbury saw the conference as a promising opportunity for mapping out a comprehensive deal with Russia over their conflicting territorial ambitions in Central Asia .
Following the Herzegovinian Rebellion started in 1875 and the Bulgarian Uprising in April 1876 , the Great Powers agreed on a project for political reforms both in Bosnia and in the Ottoman territories with a majority Bulgarian population .
Although the Turkish representatives participated in the plenaries of the conference , they were not invited to the preceding working sessions at which the Great Powers negotiated their agreement .
The conference envisaged the creation of an autonomous province including Bosnia and most of Herzegovina , while a southern part of the latter was to be ceded to Montenegro .
The Ottoman Empire was represented at the conference by : Mithat Pasha , Saffet Pasha and Edhem Pasha .
Ignatyev was trying to dispel British misgivings about Russia 's assumed role of a protector of the Orthodox Slavs being but a disguise of its drive to take over the Bosporus and Constantinople itself and thus - as Prime Minister Disraeli feared - potentially threaten the vital Mediterranean routes to British India .
The conference determined that , as of the late 19th century , the Bulgarian ethnic territories within the Ottoman Empire extended to the Danube Delta in the northeast , Kastoria in the southwest , Kirklareli and Edirne in the southeast , and Niš in the northwest .
Mithat Pasha was the Grand Vizier ( First Minister ) , and Saffet Pasha the Foreign Minister of Turkey .
The 1876-1877 Constantinople Conference ( or ` Shipyard Palace Conference ' , from the conference venue ) of the Great Powers ( Britain , Russia , France , Germany , Austria-Hungary and Italy ) was held in Istanbul ( Constantinople ) from 23 December 1876 until 20 January 1877 .
Karol Szymanowski ( 6 October 1882 - 29 March 1937 ) was a Polish composer .
Sometimes , an urban contemporary station will play classic soul music songs from the '70s and early '80s to make old people happy .
For Latino people , the music is more like music from Latin neighborhoods , such as Reggaeton , Hip hop from South America , or bachata .
The first person to use this word was the now dead New York DJ Frankie Crocker in the mid 1970s .
Their playlists are mainly singles by popular hip hop and R&B artists .
Some cities that have Urban contemporary stations are ; Los Angeles , California , New York City , Atlanta , Georgia , Chicago , Fayetteville , North Carolina , Charlotte , and Norfolk , Virginia , etc. .
The words `` urban contemporary '' make people think of African American music , like R&B .
Urban contemporary came from R&B and Soul .
Urban contemporary radio stations play only hip hop\/rap , contemporary R&B , more urban-styled pop , and on occasion , Caribbean music such as reggae and reggaeton .
By comparison , the magnetic field of the Sun averages 1 G ( 100 µT ) , although it can rise as high as 3 kG ( 0.3 T ) in active sunspot regions .
Today similar flare stars are classified as UV Ceti type variable stars in variable star catalogs .
Still the best-known flare star is UV Ceti , that star was discovered in 1948 .
Barnard 's Star is the second nearest star system to our sun and scientists suspect it is a flare star .
Flares can happen once every few days or , as in the case of Barnard 's Star , much less frequently .
The first known flare stars were discovered in 1924 , they were V1396 Cygni and AT Microscopii .
The brightness increases across the spectrum , from X rays to radio waves .
Nine stars similar to the Sun have also been seen to flare .
Most flare stars are dim red dwarfs , although research done not too long ago suggests that less massive ( lighter ) brown dwarfs might also be able to flare .
It is a UV Ceti flare star , and flares relatively often .
The more massive ( heavier ) RS Canum Venaticorum variables ( RS CVn ) are also known to flare , but scientists understand that a companion star in a binary system causes these flares .
Proxima Centauri , the nearest star to the Solar System , is also a flare star .
The mean ( average ) magnetic field varies significantly during periods of time as short as six hours .

Later composers such as Orlando de Lassus were influenced by the Italian madrigal .
The first book of sheet music printed from movable type was Harmonice Musices Odhecaton , a collection of 96 chansons by many composers , published in Venice in 1501 .
Very often `` chansons '' refers to the French songs that were sung in the late Middle Ages and Renaissance .
The earliest chansons were for two , three or four voices , many of them being for three voices .
In the Renaissance Guillaume Dufay and Gilles Binchois wrote many simple chansons .
The first important composer of chansons was the medieval composer Guillaume de Machaut .
These names were suggested by the scientists who discovered them during stellar occultations in 1984 and 1985 .
Courage , a very small and dim arc during the Voyager flyby , was seen to flare in brightness in 1998 , while more recently it was back to its usual dimness but had advanced by an additional 8 ° ahead of the other arcs .
However , visible light observations show that the total amount of material in the arcs has remained approximately steady , but they are dimmer in the infra-red where previous observations were taken .
The planet Neptune has a dim planetary ring system which is made up of several separate rings and some `` ring arcs '' .

The Sidewise Awards for Alternate History were established in 1995 .
The awards are named after the 1934 short story `` Sidewise in Time '' by Murray Leinster .
There have been three to eight judges , including judges in the UK and South Africa .
The Long-Form award may be for writing that is longer than 60,000 words .
The Short-Form award is for writing that is shorter than 60,000 words .
Pennsylvania is one of the 50 states in the United States of America .
The state capital of Pennsylvania is Harrisburg .
The current governor of Pennsylvania is Tom Corbett .
It has a border with Ohio on the west , West Virginia on the south and west , Maryland and Delaware on the south , New Jersey on the east , and New York and Lake Erie on the north .
Pennsylvania is the 33rd largest states in the United States , with a land area of 44,817 square miles .
Most of Pennsylvania is part of the Appalachian Mountains , including the south central and northeastern areas of the state .
It is in the northeastern part of the country .
Low-Temperature Fischer-Tropsch ( LTFT ) is operated at lower temperatures and uses a cobalt-based catalyst .
High-Temperature Fischer-Tropsch ( or HTFT ) is operated at temperatures of 330 ° C-350 ° C. HTFT uses an iron-based catalyst .
In October 2006 , Finnish paper and pulp manufacturer UPM announced its plans to produce biodiesel by Fischer-Tropsch process .
This Shell factory turns natural gas into low-sulfur diesel fuels and food-grade wax .
One of the largest uses of F-T technology is in Bintulu , Malaysia .
The Fischer-Tropsch process ( or Fischer-Tropsch Synthesis or F-T ) is a set of chemical reactions that turn a mixture of carbon monoxide gas and hydrogen gas into liquid hydrocarbons ( fossil fuels like gasoline or kerosene ) .
Many different catalysts can be used for the Fischer-Tropsch process .
Sasol takes coal and natural gas and uses them for the F-T Process .
Shell used LTFT in an integrated Gas-to-Liquid ( GTL ) plant in Bintulu , Malaysia .
Iron catalysts are better for when the stuff you put in is lower quality ( less pure ) such as coal or biomass .
Many times , iron catalysts change very much and form many chemical phases , like various oxides and carbides , during the reaction .
For factories that start out with methane and want to make a liquid hydrocarbon ( like kerosene ) , another important reaction is `` steam reforming '' , which turns the methane into CO ( carbon monoxide ) and H2 ( hydrogen gas ) .
Cobalt catalysts are very good for the Fischer-Tropsch process when what you are putting in is natural gas .
Jupiter was the ruler of the gods and the protector of Rome , where his temple was the center of Roman Religion and of the cult of state .
In 62 an earthquake shook the city of Pompeii , destroying much of the Temple of Jupiter .
The Temple of Jupiter , Capitolium , or Temple of the Capitoline Triad was a temple in the Roman city of Pompeii in Italy .
As the most important god in Ancient Rome , many temples were built to honor Jupiter or the entire Capitoline Triad ( a group of three gods that included Jupiter , Juno , and Minerva ) in towns newly taken over by the Romans .
The hollow temple can still be seen in Pompeii today .
After this , the much smaller Temple of Jupiter Meilichios became the main place of worship to Jupiter and his group of three ( triad ) .
The inside of the temple housed the main room of the temple , which held the statues of Jupiter , Juno , and Minerva , and which only the priests were allowed to enter .
At the beginning this temple was dedicated to Jupiter alone , it was built in the mid 2nd century BC at the same time as the temple of Apollo was being worked on - this was the era at which Roman influence over Pompeii was at its height and so Roman Jupiter beat out the Greek Apollo as the town 's highest god .
It was still allowed to mostly run itself , however , until the Italic Revolt against Rome at the beginning of the 1st century BC .
The temple had been built in 150 BC to be a very noticeable part of the forum , and it became Pompeii 's main temple after Rome took over .
Pompeii was taken over by the Romans beginning in 310 BC .
The building style of the town was largely borrowed from the Greeks , but Roman rule would soon lead to changes in this style .
Pompeii was changed into a much more public and open place .
The first Temple of Jupiter was still waiting to be fixed when Mount Vesuvius erupted in 79 , burying the town of Pompeii under lava and ash .
This was also true for Pompeii , where the Temple of Jupiter that was already there was enlarged and made more Roman when the Romans took over .

Hélène `` Hella '' Serafia Haasse ( 2 February 1918 - 29 September 2011 ) was a Dutch writer .
Haasse has received many awards for her writing .
The Académie française gave Hasse an award called the Diplôme de médaille Argent in 1984 .
In 1988 Haasse interviewed the Dutch Queen for her 50th birthday .
In 1992 , Haasse went to the opening of the IKAPI International ( Worldwide ) Book Fair in Jakarta and visited Java , where she was born .
Many people think her greatest book is Heren van de Thee ( The Tea Lords ) .
The Chilean Ministry of Education gave her a prize in 1996 .
The card was first issued to the public in July 2003 with a limited range of features and there continues to be a phased introduction of further functions .
The card is designed to reduce the number of transactions at ticket offices and the number of single paper tickets sold on the London transport network .
It is promoted by Transport for London and is valid on a number of different travel systems across London including London Underground , buses , the Docklands Light Railway ( DLR ) , London Overground , trams , some river boat services and most National Rail services within the London Fare Zones .
Use is encouraged by offering substantially cheaper fares on Oyster than payment with cash .
By June 2010 , over 34 million Oyster cards had been issued and more than 80 % of all journeys on services run by Transport for London used the Oyster card .
The Oyster card is a form of electronic ticketing used on public transport services within London .
It is also a contactless smartcard which passengers must touch onto an electronic reader when entering and leaving the transport system in order to validate it or deduct funds .
A standard Oyster card is a blue credit card-sized stored value card which can hold a variety of single tickets , period tickets and travel permits which must be added to the card prior to travel .
In 1993 , the International Radio and Television Organisation ( OIRT ) , an equivalent organization of broadcasters from Central and Eastern Europe , was merged with the EBU .
The European Broadcasting Union ( EBU ) , known in French as L'Union Européenne de Radio-Télévision ( UER ) , and unrelated to the European Union , was formed on 12 February 1950 by 23 broadcasting organizations from Europe and the Mediterranean at a conference in the coastal resort of Torquay in Devon , England .
In 1953 it was replaced by the `` Academy of the Hebrew Language '' that was established in the Hebrew University of Jerusalem on the Givat Ram campus .

Someone who studies evolutionary biology is known as an evolutionary biologist .
In the United States , as a result of the rapid growth of molecular and cell biology , many universities have split their biology departments into molecular and cell biology-style departments and ecology and evolutionary biology-style departments .
Evolutionary biology became an academic subject as a result of the modern evolutionary synthesis in the 1930s and 1940s .
It was not until the 1970s and 1980s that universities had departments that used the term evolutionary biology in their titles .
Suggestions as to how it arose include animals getting stuck in a bog , to becoming trapped in deep mud , to falling victim to drought-induced mortality around a waterhole , to getting trapped in a spring-fed pond or seep .
Potential prey included ornithopods , stegosaurs , and sauropods .
Allosaurus averaged 8.5 metres ( 28 ft ) in length , though some remains suggest it could reach over 12 meters ( 39 ft ) .
Its three-fingered forelimbs were smaller than its large hind legs , and the body was balanced by a long , heavy tail .
It is estimated that the remains of at least 46 A. fragilis have been found there , out of at least 73 dinosaurs .
The fossil site known as the Cleveland-Lloyd Dinosaur Quarry in Emery County , Utah was known in 1927 , but major operations did not begin there until 1960 .
Regardless of the cause , the great quantity of well-preserved Allosaurus remains means the animal is one of the best-known theropods .
An effort from nearly 40 institutions got thousands of bones between 1960 and 1965 .
Some paleontologists think Allosaurus had cooperative behavior , and hunted in packs .
It probably preyed on large herbivorous dinosaurs and perhaps even other predators ( e.g. Ceratosaurus ) .
Perm Krai is located in the east of the East European Plain and the western slope of the Middle Ural Mountains .
Rivers of Perm Krai belong to the Kama River Basin , the largest tributary of the Volga River .
There are more than 29,000 rivers in Perm Krai .
The city of Perm became the administrative center of the new federal subject .
A date of 1596-1597 is now accepted .

Tweed New Haven Regional Airport ( IATA : HVN , ICAO : KHVN , FAA LID : HVN ) , formerly known as Tweed-New Haven Airport , is a public airport 3 miles ( 4.8 km ) southeast of the central business district of New Haven , Connecticut , United States .
Tweed New Haven Regional Airport is currently owned by the City of New Haven .
The airport property is in New Haven and the town of East Haven .
Ammonites were marine cephalopod molluscs of the subclass Ammonoidea .
Ammonites first appeared in the early Devonian period .
Over all , the Earth is made of iron ( 32.1 % ) , oxygen ( 30.1 % ) , silicon ( 15.1 % ) , magnesium ( 13.9 % ) , sulfur ( 2.9 % ) , nickel ( 1.8 % ) , calcium ( 1.5 % ) , and aluminium ( 1.4 % ) .
The Earth is the third planet from the Sun and it is the only planet known to have life on it .
The center of the earth ( the `` core '' ) is mostly iron ( 88.8 % ) , nickel ( 5.8 % ) , sulfur ( 4.5 % ) , and less than 1 % other things .
The Earth formed around 4.5 billion years ago .
The living part of the Earth 's surface is called the `` biosphere '' .
Cockles are capable of ` jumping ' by bending and straightening the foot .
Cockles in the family Cardiidae are sometimes known as `` true cockles '' in order to distinguish them from these other species .
Confusingly , the common name `` cockle '' is also given ( by seafood sellers ) to a number of other small edible bivalves which have a somewhat similar shape , however these bivalves are in other families such as the Veneridae ( Venus clams ) and the Arcidae ( ark clams ) .
Cockles burrow using the foot , and feed by filtering plankton from the surrounding water .
The distinctive rounded shells of cockles are symmetrical , and are heart-shaped when viewed from the end .
The genus Laevicardium , the egg cockles , have very smooth shells .
The mantle has three openings ( inhalant , exhalant , and pedal ) for siphoning water and for the foot to stick out .
They are marine bivalve molluscs in the family Cardiidae .
In most genera there are numerous radial ribs ( ridges on the shell ) .
They are very common on sandy sheltered beaches throughout the world .

North of NY 7 , the highway continues as NY 787 to the city of Cohoes .
Other sources say it is at its interchange with NY 7 and NY 787 in the town of Colonie .

The location of the northern end is unclear .
Some sources say it is at 8th Street in Troy .

Spandau was one of only two Four-Power organizations to continue to operate after the breakdown of the Allied Control Council ; the other being the Berlin Air Safety Center .
This rigidity was primarily due to the much-loathed Soviet director , who perpetually enforced these measures and whom Russian and Western guards alike feared and despised .
In the aftermath of the Reichstag Fire of 1933 , opponents of Hitler and journalists such as Egon Kisch and Carl von Ossietzky were held there in so-called protective custody .
Lights out was at 22:00 hours .
In late 2008 , Media Markt left the main shopping complex .
The Soviets would offer an unchanging diet of coffee , bread , soup , and potatoes .
The four occupying powers of Berlin would alternate control of the prison on a monthly basis , each having the responsibility for a total of three months out of the year .
Each nation in charge would bring its own cook and , in the American , French , and British months , feed the prisoners better than regulations allowed .
Besides the sixty or so soldiers on duty in or around the prison at any given time , there were teams of professional civilian warders from each of the four countries , four prison directors and their deputies , four army medical officers , cooks , translators , waiters , porters and others .
The prison was demolished in 1987 , largely to prevent it from becoming a Neo-Nazi shrine , after the death of its final remaining prisoner , Rudolf Hess , who had been the prison 's sole occupant after the release of Speer and von Schirach in 1966 .
By regulation , all of the produce was to be put toward use in the prison kitchen , but prisoners and guards alike often skirted this rule and indulged in the garden 's offerings .
Bird wrote a book about Hess 's imprisonment entitled The Loneliest Man in the World .
After World War II it was operated by the Four-Power Authorities to house the Nazi war criminals sentenced to imprisonment at the Nuremberg Trials .
Supper followed at 17:00 hours , after which the prisoners were returned to their cells .
As prison regulations slackened and as prisoners became either apathetic or too ill to maintain their plots , the garden was consolidated into one large workable area .
Spandau Prison became a sort of predecessor of the Nazi concentration camps .
On days without access to the garden , for instance when it was raining , the prisoners occupied their time making envelopes together in the main corridor .
This suited the former architect Speer , who , being one of the youngest and liveliest of the inmates , later took up the task of refashioning the entire plot of land into a large complex garden , complete with paths , rock gardens , and flower displays .
Due to the number of cells available , an empty cell was left between the prisoners ' cells , to avoid the possibility of prisoners communicating in Morse Code .
Other remaining cells in the wing were designated for other purposes , with one being used for the prison library and another for a chapel .
It held up to 600 inmates at that time .
Between 1966 and 1987 , Rudolf Hess was the only inmate in Spandau Prison .
In addition , some of the sixty soldiers on guard duty manned nine machine-gun armed guard 's towers twenty-four hours a day .
His only companion was the warden , Eugene K. Bird , who became a close friend .
Compared with other established prison regulations at the time , Spandau 's rules were quite strict .
This routine , except the time allowed in the garden , changed very little throughout the years , although each of the controlling nations made their own interpretation of the prison regulations .
In 2006 a Kaiser 's Supermarket , ALDI and a Media Markt consumer electronics store occupied the former prison grounds .
Dönitz favored growing beans , Funk tomatoes , and Speer flowers , although the Soviet director subsequently banned flowers for a time .
Prisoners were given a shave and a haircut , if necessary , every Monday , Wednesday and Friday ; they did their own laundry every Monday .
Until this director 's sudden removal in the early 1960s , the ` Soviet month ' was dreaded .
Only seven prisoners were finally imprisoned there .
By the end of 1933 the first Nazi concentration camps had been built ( at Dachau , Osthofen , Oranienburg , Sonnenburg , Lichtenburg and the marshland camps around Esterwegen ) .
Afterwards , matters , including diet , were improved .
It was supposed to be controlled by the Prussian Ministry of Justice but the Gestapo tortured and abused its inmates , as Egon Erwin Kisch recalls in his memories of Spandau Prison .
The site was made into a car park and a NAAFI shopping center , named The Britannia Centre Spandau and nicknamed Hessco 's after a British supermarket chain called `` TESCO '' .
Every part of life in the prison was strictly set out by a set of rules designed before the prisoners ' arrival by the Four Powers - France , Britain , the Soviet Union , and the United States .
The garden space was first divided into small personal plots that were used by each prisoner in many ways , usually for the growing of vegetables .
Coordinates : 52 ° 31 ′ 16 ″ N 13 ° 11 ′ 07 ″ E \/ 52.52111 ° N 13.18528 ° E \/ 52.52111 ; 13.18528 Spandau Prison was a prison situated in the borough of Spandau in the British Sector of West Berlin .
The Allied powers originally took over the prison in November 1946 , expecting it to accommodate a hundred or more war criminals .
At first it was only used for soldiers but after 1919 it was also used for civilian inmates .
Arriving from Nuremberg on 18 July 1947 , they were : Of the seven , only four served all of their sentence ; the remaining three , Neurath , Raeder , and Funk , were released early due to ill health .
The cells were approximately 3 metres long by 2.7 metres wide and 4 metres high .
Every day , prisoners had to wake up at 06:00 hours , wash , clean their cells and the corridor together , eat breakfast .
All prisoners feared the months when the Soviets were in control ; the Russians were much stricter in enforcing prison regulations and offered poorer quality meals .
Western commentators accused the Russians of keeping Spandau prison in operation chiefly as a center for Soviet spying , as they had an excuse to drive into western Berlin , and the soldiers often looked out over the city instead of into the prison grounds .
All materials from the demolished prison were ground to powder and dumped in the North Sea or buried at the former RAF Gatow .
The prison , initially designed for a population in the hundreds , was an old brick building surrounded by one wall 15 feet high , another of 30 feet , a 10 foot high wall topped with electrified wire , followed by a wall of barbed wire .
The highlight of the prison , from the inmates ' point of view , was the garden .
The directors and guards of the Western powers ( France , Britain , and the United States ) , often complained about many of the stricter measures .
The prison was built in 1876 .

There are small amounts of rainfall and the summer temperature is very high .
Ancient dry riverbeds-called omuramba-traverse the Central Northern reaches of the Kalahari and provide standing pools of water during the rainy season .
The only permanent river , the Okavango , flows into a delta in the northwest , forming marshes that are rich in wildlife .
The driest areas usually receive 110-200 millimetres ( 4.3-7 .9 in ) of rain per year , and the wettest just a little over 500 millimetres ( 20 in ) .
Previously havens for wild animals from elephant to giraffe , and for predators such as lion and cheetah , the riverbeds are now mostly grazing spots , though leopard or cheetah can still be found .
Botswana Namibia South Africa
The Kalahari has a number of game reserves-the Central Kalahari Game Reserve ( CKGR , the world 's second largest protected area ) , Khutse Game Reserve and the Kgalagadi Transfrontier Park .
Animals that live in the region include brown hyenas , lions , meerkats , giraffe , warthogs , jackals and several species of antelope ( including the eland , gemsbok , springbok , hartebeest , steenbok , kudu , and duiker ) , and many species of bird and reptiles .
The surrounding Kalahari Basin covers over 2.5 million km ² extending farther into Botswana , Namibia and South Africa , and encroaching into parts of Angola , Zambia and Zimbabwe .
It has huge tracts of excellent grazing after good rains .

Oriana Fallaci ( 29 June 1929 - 15 September 2006 ) was an Italian journalist , author , and political interviewer .
Fallaci 's writings have been translated into 21 languages including English , Spanish , French , Dutch , German , Greek , Swedish , Polish , Croatian , Hungarian and Slovenian .

There are also plans to build other large solar plants in the Mojave Desert .
There are several Solar power plants in the Mojave Desert which supply power to the electricity grid .
These plants have a combined capacity of 354 megawatts ( MW ) making them the largest solar power installation in the world .
These plants can generally be built in a few years because solar plants are built almost entirely with modular , readily available materials .
Solar Energy Generating Systems ( SEGS ) is the name given to nine solar power plants in the Mojave Desert which were built in the 1980s .
Nevada Solar One is a new solar thermal plant with a 64 MW generating capacity , near Boulder City , Nevada .
Insolation ( solar radiation ) in the Mojave Desert is among the best available in the United States , and some big groups of people are in the area .
They called the throwing machine , a filatoio , and the doubler , a torcitoio .
The first evidence of a externally powered filatoio comes from the thirteenth century , and the earliest illustration from around 1500 .
The main range was three storeys high , 42.4 m by 5.5 m. Each floor was used for doubling - and there were 306 doubling machines .
Filatorios and torcitoios contained parallel circular frames that revolved round each other on a central axis .
The torcitoios and filatoios took their power from this shaft .
Lombe 's Mill was built next to Thomas Cotchett 's 1704 mill on the west bank of the River Derwent in Derby .
At this point a weir had been constructed across the river and the mill was built on an island downstream , which separated the river from the tail race of three corn mills .
The speed of the relative rotation determined the twist .
Lombe 's Mill was the first successful silk throwing mill in England .
Thomas Lombe was given a 14 year patent to protect the design of the throwing machines he used .
There is an illustration ( drawn in 1487 ) of a circular handpowered throwing machine with 32 spindles .
A Bas relief sculpture of John Lombe may be found at the nearby Exeter Bridge .
Silk would only cooperate in the process if the temperature and humidity were high , in Italy the temperature was elevated by sunlight but in Derby the mill had to be heated , and the heat evenly distributed .
It was built in an island on the River Derwent in Derby .
He returned to Derby with the knowledge and a group of Italians .
It was reported in 1732 that Lombe used a fire engine ( steam engine ) to pump hot air round the mill .
The mill then passed through several hands and has been rebuilt several times , but the modified structure still exists and has been restored to house the Derby Industrial Museum .
It was built of brick in Flemish bond , on a series of stone arches that allowed the waters of the River Derwent to flow through .
This drove a line shaft ( horizontal shaft or lay shaft ) that ran the length of the mill .
The stair column was 19.5 m high , but its layout is unknown .
He and his half brother Thomas Lombe ( born 1685 ) instructed George Sorocold to build a mill to his design and fitted it with the new machines .
The vertical shaft was extended to a further vertical shaft that reached the top 3 floors to drive the winding machines .
The mill needed to be heated in order to process the silk and this was explained in the 1718 patent .
In 1700 , the Italians were the most technologically advanced in silk throwing in Europe , and they had developed two machines capable of winding the silk onto bobbins while putting a twist in the thread .
When the patents lost effect in 1732 , other mills were built in Stockport and Macclesfield .
So John Lombe visited Piedmont in 1716 to see the successful silk throwing mill there .
To the north of the powered Italian Works an unpowered Doubling Shop was built - this happened before 1739 .
The throwing machines were two storeys high , and fastened on the first floor .
John Lombe visited Piedmont in 1717 and studied details of the Italian silk throwing machines - the filatoio , and the torcitoio .
The winding machines were placed on the top three floors .
Most of the building was rebuilt in after years , and little of the original mill remain .
Its stem entered the mill through a hole at first floor level .
His elder brother , Thomas Lombe took over the business .
The mill was sold in 1739 to Thomas Wilson , and an inventory of this time is still exists .
It is speculated that he was responsible for John Lombes mysterious death six years later in 1722 .
Thomas Cotchett built the first mill in Derby in 1704 , but it was unsuccessful .
Further information : Derby Industrial Museum This mill is significant as it was the first successful silk throwing mill in England , and probably the first fully mechanized factory in the world .
The scalloped hammerhead ( Sphyrna lewini ) is a species of hammerhead shark .
It can be found down to depths of over 500 metres ( 1,600 ft ) but is mostly found above 25 metres ( 82 ft ) .
The scalloped hammerhead is a coastal pelagic species .
It is found in warm temperate and tropical coastal waters all around the world , between latitudes 46 ° north and 36 ° south .
It was renamed Sphyrna lewini in 1834 .
It has also been known as Cestracion leeuwenii in 1865 , Zygaena erythraea in 1871 , Cestracion oceanica in 1913 , and Sphyrna diplana in 1941 .
The shark 's eyes and nostrils are placed on the ends of the cephalofoil .
It refers to the shape of the shark 's head .
It is found in warm temperate and tropical coastal waters all around the world , between latitudes 46 ° N and 36 ° S. It is the most common Hammerhead shark .
It is also known as the `` bronze hammerhead '' , the `` kidney-headed hammerhead '' , or the `` southern hammerhead '' .
The word Sphyrna is a Greek word meaning `` hammer '' .
It was first known as zygaena lewini , but is now known as Sphyrna lewini .

In December 1933 , Sir Umar took him back to India .
Sir Umar then brought him back to his homeland , where he gave up chess and returned to his humble life .
At that time , Sir Umar took him into his household with the idea of teaching him the European version of the game and introducing him to European master chess .
In matches he defeated Tartakower in 1931 ( four wins , five draws , and three losses ) and narrowly lost to Flohr in 1932 ( one win , three draws , and two losses ) .
Sultan Khan again won the British Championship in 1932 and 1933 .
In 1928 , he won the all-India championship , scoring eight wins , one draw , and no losses .
In an international chess career of less than five years ( 1929-33 ) , he won the British Chess Championship three times in four tries ( 1929 , 1932 , 1933 ) , and had tournament and match results that put him among the top ten players in the world .
To everyone 's surprise , he won .
Malik Mir Sultan Khan ( 1905 - 25 April 1966 ) was the strongest chess master of his time from Asia .
After that , he was never heard of by the chess world again .
He was a manservant from British India who traveled with his master , Colonel Nawab Sir Umar Hayat Khan , to Britain , where he took the chess world by storm .
Next year , in May 1930 , Sultan Khan began an international chess career in which he defeated many of the world 's leading players .
At the 5th Chess Olympiad , Folkestone 1933 , he had his worst result , an even score , winning four games , drawing six , and losing four .
His best results were second to Savielly Tartakower at Liège 1930 ; third at the Hastings International Chess Congress 1930-31 behind future World Champion Max Euwe and former World Champion José Raúl Capablanca ; fourth at Hastings 1931-32 ; fourth at Bern 1932 ; and a tie for third with at London 1932 , behind World Champion Alexander Alekhine and Salo Flohr .
In 1935 , he won a match against V.K. Khadilkar , yielding just one draw in ten games .
At the 3rd Chess Olympiad , Hamburg 1930 , he scored nine wins , four draws , and four losses ( 64.7 % ) .
By the time Sultan Khan was 21 he was the strongest player in the Punjab .
Sultan Khan played three times on first board for England at Chess Olympiads .
Sultan Khan learned the Indian form of chess from his father at the age of nine .
At the 4th Chess Olympiad , Prague 1931 , he faced a much stronger field .
The main feature was that pawns did not move two squares on their first move .

The Goombas were included in the Ice Capades show featuring characters from the Mario series .
Early pictures for the Super Mario Bros. film showed that the design of the Goombas were originally intended to be for Koopa Troopas , another kind of Mario enemy .
A separate company from the primary makeup departments designed the Goombas in the film .
They used a single picture twice to make people think the Goombas are walking , rotating it back and forth , causing it to look lopsided as it walks and giving the motion the appearance of a trot .
The Goomba 's resemblance to the Super Mushroom forced designers to change what the Super Mushroom does and what it looks like .
The Goombas are designed after a kind of mushroom called shiitake .
