The Waldsiedlung ( engl .
Very dark brown to black hornblendes that contain titanium may be called basaltic hornblende , from the fact that they are usually a constituent of basalt and related rocks .
It is an isomorphous mixture of three molecules ; a calcium-iron-magnesium silicate , an aluminium-iron-magnesium silicate , and an iron-magnesium silicate .
Hornblende has a hardness of 5-6 , a specific gravity of 2.9-3 .4 and is typically an opaque green , greenish-brown , brown or black color .
It is the principal mineral of amphibolites .
Hornblende is not a recognized mineral in its own right , but the name is used as a general or field term , to refer to a dark amphibole .
It is most often confused with the minerals augite and biotite mica , both of which are black and can be found in granite .
Hornblende is a common constituent of many igneous and metamorphic rocks such as granite , diorite , gabbro , basalt , andesite , gneiss , and schist .
The word hornblende is derived from the German horn and blenden , to ` blind ' or ` dazzle ' .
After Prussia was dissolved by the allied powers in 1947 , the area was divided between the German states of Brandenburg , Mecklenburg , Saxony , Saxony-Anhalt und Thuringia .
The Soviet Occupation Zone ( German : Sowjetische Besatzungszone ( SBZ ) or Ostzone Russian : Советская зона Германии , Sovetskaya zona Germanii , `` Soviet Zone of Germany '' ) was the area of eastern Germany occupied by the Soviet Union from 1945 on , at the end of World War II .
The Social Democratic Party of Germany ( SPD ) and the Communist Party of Germany were merged into the Socialist Unity Party of Germany ( which became the governing party of East Germany ) .
On October 8 , 1949 , the Soviet zone became the German Democratic Republic , usually known simply as East Germany .
This became East Germany The Soviet occupation zone included the central parts of Prussia .
The Soviet Military Administration in Germany ( German initials : SMAD ) allowed four political parties to form , but they all had to work in the `` All-Party Committee '' ( the `` Nationale Front '' ) .

Shales and mudrocks contain roughly 95 percent of the organic matter in all sedimentary rocks .
Shales are typically deposited in very slow moving water and are often found in lakes and lagoonal deposits , in river deltas , on floodplains and offshore from beach sands .
Mudstones , on the other hand , are similar in composition but do not show the fissility .
However , this amounts to less than one percent by mass in an average shale .
They can also be deposited on the continental shelf , in relatively deep , quiet water .
Shale is characterized by breaks along thin laminae or parallel layering or bedding less than one centimeter in thickness , called `` fissility '' ( = ~ splitting ) .
` Black shales ' are dark , as a result of being especially rich in unoxidized carbon .
The ratio of clay to other minerals is variable .
They are common in some Palaeozoic and Mesozoic strata , Some black shales contain abundant heavy metals such as molybdenum , uranium , vanadium , and zinc .
The mud is a mix of flakes of clay minerals and tiny fragments ( silt-sized particles ) of other minerals , especially quartz and calcite .
Shale is a fine-grained sedimentary rock formed from mud .
Black shales are deposited in anoxic or low oxygen environments , such as in stagnant water columns .

Helen Hayes Brown ( October 10 , 1900 - March 17 , 1993 ) was an American actress .
Helen Hayes was born in Washington D.C. on October 10 , 1890 .
Her first sound movie The Sin of Madelon Claudet ( 1931 ) brought her Academy Award for Best Actress .
In 1917 Helen graduated from the Academy of the Sacred Heart Convent in Washington .
Her father , Francis van Arnum Brown , was a meat salesman .
By the age of ten , she had made a short movie .
Known as the `` First Lady of the American Theatre '' , she is one of only thirteen people to win all four main American entertainment awards - Emmy , Grammy , Oscar and Tony .
Hayes also received the Presidential Medal of Freedom in 1986 , the National Medal of Arts in 1988 and was awarded at the Kennedy Center Honors in 1981 .

Many tree frogs can change their color for better camouflage .
They do not normally descend to the ground , except to mate and spawn , though some build foam nests on leaves and rarely leave the trees at all as adults .
While some reach 10 cm ( 4 in ) or more , they are typically smaller and more slender than terrestrial frogs .
Tree frogs are usually tiny , as their weight has to be carried by the branches and twigs of their habitat .
The genus Chiromantis is most extreme in this respect : it can oppose two fingers to the other two , resulting in a vice-like grip .
Typical for `` tree frogs '' are the well-developed discs at the finger and toe tips ; the fingers and toes themselves as well as the limbs tend to be rather long , resulting in a superior grasping ability .

The treat motivates the animals to perform the trick consistently , even later when the treat is removed from the process .
A drive or desire is a deficiency or need that activates behavior aimed at a goal or an incentive .
For example , hunger is a motivation which causes a desire to eat .
By contrast , outside rewards and stimuli are used in training animals by giving them treats when they perform a trick correctly .
Drives often occur within the individual and may not need external stimuli to encourage the behavior .

There are two basic kinds of cards : `` spells '' and `` lands '' .
A player starts the game with twenty `` life points '' .
A player can have no more than seven cards at the end of their turn .
Richard Garfield started to make the game at University of Pennsylvania .
Lands give its player `` mana '' ( magical energy ) .
Players begin the game by shuffling their decks ( mixing up their cards ) and then taking up seven cards .
A player may only play one land each turn .
Magic : The Gathering is a trading card game .
Players can play in tournaments , and there are even professional Magic players .
More powerful spells take more mana to play .
Players takes one new card at the start of each turn , but the first player does not take a card on their first turn .

Coordinates : 51 ° 19 ′ 20.44 ″ N 12 ° 23 ′ 48.11 ″ E \/ 51.3223444 ° N 12.3966972 ° E \/ 51.3223444 ; 12.3966972 ( German National Library , Leipzig Building ) The main building of the German National Library in Leipzig was built 1914-1916 after plans of the architect Oskar Pusch .
In July 2000 , the DMA also assumed the role as repository for GEMA , Gesellschaft für musikalische Aufführungs - und mechanische Vervielfältigungsrechte , a German music copyright organization .
The Library began its work in the tobacco room of the former Rothschild library , which served the bombed university library as accommodation .
The central reading room contains a picture by Ludwig von Hofmann , depicting Arcadia in Art Nouveau-style .
The expansion of the collection brief to include online publications set the course for collecting , cataloguing and storing such publications as part of Germany 's cultural heritage .
On the facade , the portraits of Otto von Bismarck , Johann Wolfgang von Goethe and Johannes Gutenberg are displayed .
A third facility , the Deutsches Musikarchiv Berlin ( founded 1970 ) , deals with all music-related archiving ( both printed and recorded materials ) .
Publishers of printed and recorded music in Germany are required by law ( since 1973 ) to deliver two copies of every edition to the archive .
The US military government gave its approval .
For example , it is the leading partner in developing and maintaining bibliographic rules and standards in Germany and plays a significant role in the development of international library standards .
The city of Frankfurt agreed to support the planned archive library with personnel and financial resources .
The 210,000 works of printed music previously held by GEMA were transferred to DMA .
Statues represent Technology , Justice , Philosophy , Medicine etc. .
The Library 's highest management body , the Administrative Council , was expanded to include two MPs from the Bundestag .
The federal state representatives of the book trade in the American zone agreed to the proposal .
In 1946 Dr. Georg Kurt Schauer , Heinrich Cobet , Vittorio Klostermann and Professor Hanns Wilhelm Eppelsheimer , director of the Frankfurt University Library , initiated the re-foundation of a German archive library based in Frankfurt am Main .
The German National Library maintains co-operative external relations on the national and international level .
In 1912 , the town of Leipzig , seat of the annual Leipzig Book Fair , the kingdom of Saxony and the Börsenverein der Deutschen Buchhändler ( Association of German booksellers ) agreed to found a German National Library located in Leipzig .
In the same year , Dr. Gustav Wahl was elected as the first director .
Situated in Berlin 's Lichterfelde , the DMA constitutes a department of the German National Library ( Deutsche Nationalbibliothek ) .
The cooperation with publishers is regulated by law since 1935 for the Deutsche Bücherei Leipzig , since 1969 for the Deutsche Bibliothek Frankfurt .
The impressive facade is 160 m long and faces the `` Deutscher Platz '' .
The `` Law regarding the German National Library '' came into force on 29 June 2006 .
Starting January 1 , 1913 , all publications in German language were systematically collected ( including books from Austria and Switzerland ) .
Duties are shared between the facilities in Leipzig and Frankfurt am Main , with each center having a specific specialty area .
The law also changed the name of the library and its buildings in Leipzig , Frankfurt am Main and Berlin into `` Deutsche Nationalbibliothek '' .
The building was opened on October 19 , 1916 , one day after the monument for the Battle of the Nations .
The building lot of the library had been donated by the city of Leipzig , while Friedrich August III , king of Saxony provided the funds for the building .
Construction work began in 2006 and is to be completed in 2009 .
The stock of books already in existence was stored at the Germanisches Nationalmuseum in Nuremberg .
The DMA is planned to move to Leipzig , to be housed in an extension of the Deutsche Nationalbibliothek in Leipzig .
Its task is to collect , archive , document and record bibliographically all German and German language publications from 1913 on , foreign publications about Germany , translations of German works , and the works of German-speaking emigrants published abroad between 1933 and 1945 , and to make them available to the public .
With the unification of Germany on 3 October 1990 , the Deutsche Bücherei Leipzig and the Deutsche Bibliothek Frankfurt am Main were merged in the new institution Die Deutsche Bibliothek .
It is a federal agency founded in 1970 with the task to collect all music published in the country .
Its precursor was the Deutsche Musik-Phonothek ( 1961-1969 ) .
The German National Library ( Deutsche Nationalbibliothek , abbreviated DNB ) is the central library and national bibliographic center for the Federal Republic of Germany .

I 've Got a Secret was a weekly game show produced by Mark Goodson and Bill Todman for CBS television .
The Oxygen channel version of the show was hosted by Stephanie Miller until August 2001 .
Garry Moore left the show after the 1963-64 season , after his comedy program The Garry Moore Show was canceled , and he decided to retire from television to travel around the world with his wife .

In October 2006 , GSN decided not to renew the show for a second season , although reruns remained on its schedule for some time afterward .

Later , Ronald Fisher and J.B.S. Haldane showed that discrete mutations were compatible with gradual evolution : see the modern evolutionary synthesis .
Bateson first used the term `` genetics '' publicly at the Third International Conference on Plant Hybridization in London in 1906 .
Bateson co-discovered genetic linkage with Reginald Punnett , and he and Punnett founded the Journal of Genetics in 1910 .
Bateson also coined the term `` epistasis '' to describe the genetic interaction of two independent traits .
Although this was three years before Wilhelm Johannsen used the word `` gene '' to describe the units of hereditary information , De Vries had introduced the word `` pangene '' for the same concept already in 1889 and etymologically the word genetics finds its origin in Darwin 's concept of pangenesis .
He was the first person to use the term genetics to describe the study of heredity , and the chief populariser of the ideas of Gregor Mendel , after their rediscovery in 1900 by Hugo de Vries and Carl Correns .
William Bateson ( Yorkshire , 8 August 1861 - 8 February 1926 ) was a British zoologist , a Fellow of St. John 's College , Cambridge University .
Bateson was the first to suggest the word `` genetics '' to describe the study of inheritance , in a letter to Adam Sedgwick , dated April 18 , 1905 .
It also had religious and strategic importance to the Armenians , housing the Ghazanchetsots Cathedral , the church of Kanach Zham and serving ( along with Lachin district to the west ) as a land link to Armenia .
The city was also a major center of Armenian cultural and economic life until the World War I. Along with Tbilisi ; it was one of the two main Armenian cities of the Transcaucasus and the center of a self-governing Armenian principality in the 1720s .
On May 8-9 , 1992 the city was captured by Armenian armed forces .
After serving as a town and an ancient fortress in the Armenian Principality of Varanda , Shusha was turned into the capital of the Karabakh khanate .
Shusha was a popular mountainous-climatic recreation resort in the Soviet Union .

Johannes Peter `` Honus '' Wagner ( \/ ˈhɒnəs ˈwæɡnər \/ ; February 24 , 1874 - December 6 , 1955 ) was an American Major League Baseball shortstop .
Honus started playing for the Inter-State League in 1895 .
He held the league record for slugging percentage six times , and the record for stolen bases five times .
He was inducted ( added to ) the Baseball Hall of Fame in 1936 .
In 1897 , Wagner played 74 games and hit .375 .

In mathematics , a Riemann sum is a sum that makes an approximation of the total area underneath a curve on a graph .
In Mississippi , Governor Haley Barbour declared a state of emergency .
Before of the depression 's development , several oil and gas companies removed unneeded workers from offshore oil platforms in the northern Gulf of Mexico ; the Shell Oil Company evacuated about 700 employees , while Noble Energy removed its workforce of about 300 people from two oil rigs .
Officials in New Orleans opened three emergency shelters , stating the possible need of shelter for citizens in about 17,000 FEMA trailers after Hurricane Katrina .
With 27.7 % of the daily crude oil production stopped because of the depression , oil prices rose higher after days of increasing levels , and on September 20 reached a record rate of over $ 84 per barrel .
The cyclone continued moving northwestward , making landfall around 0000 UTC on September 22 near Fort Walton Beach , Florida with winds of 35 mph ( 55 km\/h ) .
In other places , rainfall totals reached 1.46 inches ( 37.1 mm ) in Albany , Georgia and 0.51 inches ( 13 mm ) in Dothan , Alabama .
Because of the threat of the cyclone , Louisiana governor Kathleen Blanco also declared a state of emergency and placed the state 's National Guard and other disaster services on stand-by .
Officials ordered a mandatory evacuation for people living in areas of low lands and in mobile homes for Jackson , Harrison , and Hancock counties .
Shortly thereafter , an inland tropical storm warning was given out for Pearl River , Walthall , and Pike counties in Mississippi and Washington Parish in Louisiana .
Outer rainbands began affecting coastal sections of western Florida by about 12 hours before the formation of the depression .
Also , the New Orleans National Weather Service gave out a coastal flood watch for four parishes in southeastern Louisiana .
The storm formed as a subtropical depression on September 21 in the northeastern Gulf of Mexico from the contact of a tropical wave , the end of a cold front , and a low pressure system .
The tornado destroyed 20 homes , left 30 others severely damaged , and injured one person , and cut power for about 300 people .
In spite of its bad organization , with a disorganized circulation and an upper-level low aloft , the National Hurricane Center started advisories on Subtropical Depression Ten at 1500 UTC on September 21 while it was located about 40 miles ( 60 km ) south of St. Vincent Island , Florida , stating `` the potential for additional development right along the coastline . ''
The depression also created waves of about 5 feet ( 1.5 m ) and rip currents along the west coast of Florida .
Together , the wind shear and low-level helicity created moderate convection across central Florida associated with the precursor low pressure system .
Moving northwestward , the depression came onto land near Fort Walton Beach early on September 22 , and shortly later , it dissipated over southeastern Alabama .
The cloud pattern began to become disorganized as it moved inland , and 3 hours after it moved ashore the National Hurricane Center gave out its last advisory on the depression .
At the same time the National Hurricane Center gave out its first advisory on the depression , they also gave out a tropical storm warning from Apalachicola , Florida to the delta of the Mississippi River .
Late on September 20 , a supercell formed near Lake Apopka , and moved quickly northward it created an EF1 tornado near Eustis ; the tornado moved around for about 2 miles ( 3 km ) and reached winds of about 100 mph ( 160 km\/h ) .
The circulation became better organized as convection modestly increased over the center , and within 6 hours of its formation , the system turned into a tropical depression .
With a mid-level ridge to its northwest , the subtropical depression was predicted to move alongside with the coastline of Florida and Alabama .
Tropical Depression Ten was a short-lived tropical cyclone that moved onto land on western Florida in September 2007 .
As a outcome , the cyclone was forecasted to have winds of 45 mph ( 75 km\/h ) and move onto land on southern Mississippi .
A Hurricane Hunters aircraft was sent to fly into the system on September 20 reported an organized low and strong wind gusts in the storm as it moved into the northeastern Gulf of Mexico , along with little and disorganized thunderstorm activity .
Originally , the system was very disorganized , but surface pressures slowly went down across the area , with a weak low pressure area forming on September 19 .
An upper-level low over western Florida created more convection across the area , and on September 18 the system began moving towards Florida .
Convection slowly became better organized , with a well-defined rainband in its eastern half and irregular thunderstorm activity near the center .
The depression caused only light damages to the area and was limited to light rainfall , although the system that would later become Tropical Depression 10 created a damaging tornado in Eustis , Florida .

Some clay deposits found in the process of exploring caves exhibit thixotropism : an initially solid-seeming mudbank will turn soupy and yield up moisture when dug into or otherwise disturbed .
Similarly , a lahar is a mass of earth liquefied by a volcanic event , which rapidly solidifies once coming to rest .
A thixotropic fluid is a fluid which takes a finite time to attain equilibrium viscosity when introduced to a step change in shear rate .
These clays were deposited in the past by low-velocity streams which tend to deposit fine-grained sediment .
Many gels and colloids are thixotropic materials , exhibiting a stable form at rest but becoming fluid when agitated .
Another example of a thixotropic fluid is the synovial fluid found in joints between some bones .
Constant shear stress can be applied by shaking or mixing .
Some fluids are anti-thixotropic : constant shear stress for a time causes an increase in viscosity or even solidification .
Honey from honey bees may also exhibit this property under certain conditions .
In more technical language : some Non-Newtonian fluids show a change in viscosity ; the longer the fluid undergoes shear stress , the lower its viscosity .
Drilling muds used in geotechnical applications can be thixotropic .
They are much less common .
Some clays are thixotropic , with their behavior is of great importance in structural and geotechnical engineering .
Landslides , such as those common in the cliffs around Lyme Regis , Dorset and in the Aberfan disaster in Wales are evidence of this .
( Heather honey ) .
Thixotropy is the property of certain gels or fluids that are thick ( viscous ) under normal conditions , but flow ( become thin , less viscous ) when shaken , agitated , or otherwise stressed .

A landslide includes a wide range of ground movement , such as rock falls , deep failure of slopes and shallow debris flows .
Herbaceous plants may be annuals , biennials or perennials but most are annuals and die at the end of their growing season ( the time when they produce flowers , fruits and seeds ) , leaving their seeds on the soil ; those seeds will produce new plants with good weather .
A herbaceous plant is a plant that does not have much wood and its stems are green and soft .

He paints songlines , or the journeys taken by the ancestral beings of his Dreaming country - such as the kanyaḻa ( euro ) , malu ( red kangaroo ) , wiilu ( stone-curlew ) , waru ( wallaby ) and kaḻaya ( emu ) .
Because of his old age , Minyintiri only paints six to eight artworks a year .
Minyintiri won the 28th NATSIAA in August 2011 , for his painting Kanyalakutjina ( `` Euro Tracks '' ) .
In 2010 , Minyintiri 's painting Malukutjina ( `` Red Kangaroo Tracks '' ) was chosen as a finalist for the 27th National Aboriginal & Torres Strait Islander Art Award .
Minyintiri began painting at Ernabella Arts in late 2005 .
He is said to be the oldest artist at Pukatja , and also the community 's most senior lawman ( a keeper of Tjukurpa or sacred knowledge ) .
The award was won by Jimmy Donegan , another Pitjantjatjara artist , from Kalka .
Dickie Minyintiri ( born c. 1915 ) is an Australian Aboriginal artist from Pukatja , South Australia .
The network of lines traces the tracks of ancestral spirits ( kangaroos , dogs and emu ) to important waterholes , where men also went for their ceremonies .
Minyintiri was about 96 at the time .
His work was compared to the early batik works of Emily Kngwarreye .
He began painting in 2005 , when he was about 90 years old .
His childhood was spent living nomadically in the desert with his family .
His work was chosen from over 300 entries , which had been reduced to 61 finalists .
Before he became a painter , Minyintiri crafted traditional wooden tools ( mostly spears ) .
Kanyalakutjina is a multi-layered synthetic painting , done on a large canvas .
Minyintiri was born into a Pitjantjatjara family some time around 1915 .
He was born in the bush at Pilpirinyi , Western Australia , near the border with South Australia .
His works have been shown in many group exhibitions since 2006 , in most major Australian cities .
Minyintiri originally painted on paper , but now paints on canvas .
Each layer and line is a memory of a journey Minyintiri has made .
The judges praised Minyintiri for his subtle use of color .
The painting is therefore a reflection of the artist 's years of traveling his country , and an expression of his ancestral relationship to the land .
His art is often also a reflection of his younger life in the desert , before settling permanently at Ernabella .
They camped for several years around the Musgrave Ranges near what would later become the settlement of Ernabella .
The painting depicts a sacred men 's ceremonial site near Pilpirinyi .
Flashes of blue , black and pink peep through the surface lines .
Most of Minyintiri 's paintings are done using synthetic polymer paint on canvases .
Their homelands were spread over a large area along the border , but they often traveled far to the east for ceremonies .
The family had their first contact with Western civilisation in the 1920s , when Minyintiri was still a child .
The religious elements of his works are always obscured , for cultural reasons .
After winning the National Aboriginal & Torres Strait Islander Art Award in 2011 , he is now a very successful artist .

The first Royal Rumble took place on January 24 , 1988 and was broadcast live on the USA Network .
From 2001 to 2007 the Royal Rumble match winner has gone on to win a World Championship title at WrestleMania .
The first Rumble match featured only twenty men , and it was called the Rumble Royale .
The tradition of granting a WWE Championship match at WrestleMania started in 1993 .
The Royal Rumble is a pay-per-view consisting of the Royal Rumble match , championship matches , and various other matches .
The pay-per-view is part of WWE 's `` Big Four '' , along with WrestleMania , SummerSlam , and Survivor Series .
For instance , Chris Benoit switched brands in 2004 and won the World Heavyweight Championship .
Starting in 2004 , the Rumble winner had the option of challenging either brand 's champion .
At first , the winner of the match received a shot at his brand 's champion .
It is part of WWE 's `` classic five '' pay-per-views , along with WrestleMania , Survivor Series , SummerSlam , and King of the Ring .
He also became the first man since 2000 to win the Royal Rumble match but fail to win the title in his championship opportunity as a result .
After winning the 2008 match , John Cena became the first to use his championship opportunity at an event other than WrestleMania .
The reward for the 1992 Royal Rumble was the WWF Championship .
Today , Rumble matches are much longer , with the longest match , at the 2002 event , lasting over 1 hour and 9 minutes of a 3-hour pay-per-view .
Participants must eliminate all other opponents , and the winner of the event is the last wrestler remaining after all others have been eliminated .
The Royal Rumble is a yearly professional wrestling pay-per-view event , aired every January by World Wrestling Entertainment ( WWE ) .
It lasted about 33 minutes of the 2-hour broadcast .
With the brand extension introduced in mid-2002 , the 30 entrants from 2003 to 2006 had 15 wrestlers from both the RAW and SmackDown !
The 2008 Royal Rumble was the first WWE pay-per-view to be aired in HD .
The idea behind the Royal Rumble match is credited to Pat Patterson .
The Royal Rumble is also one of WWE 's more popular pay-per-views .
The show 's main event is a Battle Royal-type match , named the Royal Rumble match .
Similar to a Battle Royal , a wrestler is eliminated when thrown over the top rope , with both feet touching the floor .
The following year , the event became a pay-per-view .
The Royal Rumble match is usually at the top of the card .
At regular timed intervals , usually ninety seconds , one of the remaining 28 wrestlers enters the ring .
Beginning in 2004 , the winner had their choice of a World Heavyweight Championship or WWE Championship match at WrestleMania .
The 2007 Royal Rumble marked the first year participants from the ECW brand competed along with the RAW and SmackDown !

In the summer of 1969 , the ninth SDS national convention was held at the Chicago Coliseum with some 2000 people attending .
Night-time raids on draft offices began to spread .
The demonstration in Washington , DC attracted about 25,000 anti-war protesters and SDS became the leading student group against the war on most U.S. campuses .
A rally and a student strike then closed the university for several days .
There were nine chapters around the country with at most , about 1000 members .
Demonstrations against the draft led by members of the Resistance , the War Resisters League , and SDS added fuel to the fire of resistance .
Soon hundreds more , all over the country , were held .
The first teach-in against the war was held in the University of Michigan .
The huge ( 100,000 people ) October 21 March on the Pentagon saw hundreds arrested and hurt .
It was mostly ignored by the New York City-based national media , which was more focused on the student shutdown of Columbia University in NYC , led by an inter-racial alliance of Columbia SDS chapter activists and Student Afro Society activists .
The national office ( NO ) in New York City had only a few desks , some broken chairs , a couple of filing cabinets , and a few typewriters .
In the spring of 1968 , National SDS activists led an effort on the campuses called `` Ten Days of Resistance '' and local chapters held rallies , marches , sit-ins and teach-ins , ending in a one-day strike on April 26 .
After regular civil rights tactics of peaceful pickets , the Oakland California Stop the Draft Week ended in mass hit and run fights with the police .
Hundreds of students were arrested .
Campus chapters of SDS all over the country started to lead small , local demonstrations against the war and the NO became the main group that organized the March against the war in Washington DC on April 17 .
The school year started with a large demonstration against the University of Wisconsin in Madison , Wisconsin on October 17 for letting Dow recruiters on campus .
About a million students stayed away from classes that day , the largest ever student strike in the history of the United States .
Peaceful at first , the demonstrations turned to a sit-in that was violently broken up by the Madison police and riot squad , causing many injuries and arrests .
That Fall saw more anti-war actions .
The 1965 summer convention was held at Kewadin , Northern Michigan .
Led by a Friends of SNCC student activist named Mario Savio , more than three thousand students surrounded a police car where a student , arrested for setting up a card table against a ban by the University , was being taken away .
SDS held its first meeting in 1960 at Ann Arbor , Michigan .
The demonstrations , meetings and strikes all but shut the university down .
The Students for a Democratic Society ( SDS ) was a student activist movement in the United States in the 1960s ( 1960 to 1969 ) .

One painting , Portrait of a Youth by Dosso Dossi at the National Gallery of Victoria , was identified as a portrait of Lucrezia in November 2008 .
Several other paintings , such as Veneto 's fanciful portrait , have also been said to depict her but none has been accepted by scholars at present .
This painting may be the only surviving formal portrait of Lucrezia Borgia ; however , doubts have been cast on that claim .

Lucrezia is described as having heavy blonde hair which fell past her knees , a beautiful complexion , hazel eyes which changed color , a full , high bosom , and a natural grace which made her appear to `` walk on air '' .

The Cairo International Book Fair is one of the biggest book fairs in the world with hundreds of book sellers and about two million visitors every year .
The CIBF was started by the General Egyptian Book Organisation , a government publishers and retailers group , in 1969 as part of the celebrations of the 1000th anniversary of the start of the city of Cairo .
It is held every year in the last week of January in Cairo , Egypt , at the Cairo International Fair Grounds in Madinat Nasr , near Al-Azhar University .
This led to rare public protests against the Egyptian government , violence , 75 arrests and a number of injuries .
The state owned General Egyptian Book Organisation , is the largest book publisher in the Arab world .
Lectures , readings , and other public events take place during the three weeks the of the book fair , with items in Arabic , English , and other languages .
The fair brings in ordinary Egyptians , with media on a range of topics , outdoor events , and even fireworks to entertain the large crowds .
The 41st fair was held from 21 January to 5 February 2009 .
In later years a number of books from foreign publishers have been taken by Egyptian authorities .
The fair has displays and speakers from publishers and government agencies from around the world , as well as sellers of books , video , and other media .
Leftist and Muslim militant authors , works critical of the government , and works with sections or topics that are seen as sexually or culturally controversial have been banned from the book fair .

His research involves the generation and reactivity of carbocations using superacids .
In recent years , his research has shifted from hydrocarbons ( including hydrocarbon fuel ) to the methanol economy .

The Olah family formed an endowment fund ( the George A. Olah Endowment ) .

It is an officially recognized minority language in Istria County ( where it is spoken by 7.69 % of the population ) .
The 2001 census in Croatia reported 19,636 ethnic Italians in the country ( some .44 % of the total population ) .
Government services are provided in Italian and Croatian in Istria County , including the official government website ( which is also available in English ) .
Native Italian speakers are largely concentrated along the Adriatic coast .
There are four Italian-language schools in Istria : primary schools in Buje ( Buie ) and Novigrad ( Cittanova ) and secondary schools in Pula ( Pola ) and Rovinj ( Rovigno ) .
In addition , roughly 120,000 Italian tourists visit Croatia each year , so many in the service and tourist industries have some knowledge of the language .

The bowerbirds have an Austro-Papuan distribution , with ten species endemic to New Guinea , eight endemic to Australia and two found in both .
The family has 20 species in eight genera .
Their diet consists mainly of fruit but may also include insects ( especially for nestlings ) , flowers , nectar and leaves in some species .
The birds are medium to large-sized passerines , ranging from the Golden Bowerbird at 22 centimetres ( 8.7 in ) and 70 grams ( 2.5 oz ) to the Great Bowerbird at 40 centimetres ( 16 in ) and 230 grams ( 8.1 oz ) .
They occupy a range of different habitats , including rainforest , eucalyptus and acacia forest , and shrublands .
Their distribution is mainly in the tropical parts of New Guinea and northern Australia , though some species extend into central , western and southeastern Australia .
Bowerbirds are most known for their unique courtship behavior , where males build a structure and decorate it with sticks and brightly colored objects .
The Satin and Spotted Bowerbirds are sometimes regarded as pests because they feed on introduced fruit and vegetable crops .
Common names include `` queen conch '' and `` pink conch '' in English , caracol rosa and caracol rosado in Mexico , caracol de pala , cobo , botuto and guarura in Venezuela , caracol reina , lambí in the Dominican Republic , and carrucho in Puerto Rico .
This species is one of the largest molluscs native to the tropical northwestern Atlantic , from Bermuda to Brazil , reaching up to 35.2 centimetres ( 13.9 in ) in shell length .
Lobatus gigas , commonly known as the queen conch , is a species of large edible sea snail , a marine gastropod mollusc in the family of true conches , the Strombidae .
According to one perspective , it is directly from the Qur ` an , constantly recited , meditated , and experienced , that Sufism proceeded , in its origin and its development .
Others have held that Sufism is the strict emulation of the direct way of the Holy Prophet Muhammad , through which the heart 's connection to the Divine is strengthened .
Important contributions in writing are attributed to Uwais al-Qarni , Harrm bin Hian , Hasan Basri and Sayid ibn al-Mussib , who are regarded as among the first Sufis in the earliest generations of Islam .
Additionally , the Muslim conquests had brought large numbers of Christian monks and hermits , especially in Syria and Egypt , under Muslim rule .
In its early stages of development Sufism referred to nothing more than the personalization and internalization of Islam .

There are more digits in the front flippers than is usual in ichthyosaurs ; they are tightly bound in rows , giving a broad , flat appearance .
It had a long snout and a powerful finned tail .
Fossils are known from Australia , Russia , United States of America , Colombia , Western Europe and possibly New Zealand .
This unusual characteristic gives the genus its name , meaning ` flat wing . '
Platypterygius reached a length of about 7 m ( 23 ft ) .
Like other ichthyosaurs , Platypterygius gave live birth .
CAT scans on a juvenile specimen strongly suggest that Platypterygius was deaf .
Furthermore , some of the wrist bones have disappeared entirely .
Both adults and juveniles have been unearthed , including newborns and pregnant females .
Platypterygius ( ` flat flipper ) ' is an ichthyosaur of the family Ophthalmosauridae .

George Gaylord Simpson ( 16 June 1902 - 6 October 1984 ) was an American paleontologist .
He coined the word hypodigm in 1940 , and published extensively on the taxonomy of fossil and living mammals .
Simpson dispelled the myth that the evolution of the horse was a linear process culminating in the modern Equus caballus .
Simpson was awarded the Linnean Society 's Darwin-Wallace Medal in 1958 .
Simpson was perhaps the most influential paleontologist of the twentieth century , and a major participant in the modern evolutionary synthesis .
Simpson opposed Alfred Wegener 's theory of continental drift , so his work on animal migration lacked this idea .
He was promoted to Curator ( head ) of the Department of Geology and Paleontology at the American Museum of Natural History .
He was an expert on extinct mammals and their migrations , especially the Great American Interchange between the Americas .

2011 he played on loan for SV Ried .
Hurricane Ike was the ninth named storm , fifth hurricane , and third major hurricane and the strongest hurricane of 2008 .
Ike may have caused up to 195 deaths .
Most countries have their own government public health agencies , sometimes known as ministries of health , to respond to domestic health issues .
In the developing world , there may not be enough trained health workers or monetary resources to provide a basic level of medical care and disease prevention .
Public health has roots in antiquity .
From the beginning , human civilization recognized that polluted water and lack of proper waste disposal spread communicable diseases .
The Chinese developed the practice of variolation following a smallpox epidemic around 1000 BC .
Public health plays an important role in disease prevention efforts in the developing world and in developed countries , through local health systems and through international non-governmental organizations .
During the 14th century Black Death in Europe , burning parts of cities resulted in benefit , since it destroyed the rodent infestations .
Many diseases are preventable through simple , non-medical methods .
The development of quarantine in the medieval period restricted effects of other infectious diseases .
Early religions attempted to regulate behavior related to health , from types of food eaten , to behaviors , such as drinking alcohol or sexual relations .
In outbreaks of an infectious disease , treating a disease may be vital to preventing it in others .
Later they started build of sewers , the regular collection of garbage , incineration or disposal , providing clean water and draining standing water to prevent the breeding of mosquitos .
The increase in average life span in the 20th century is credited to public health achievements , such as vaccination programs and control of infectious diseases , effective safety policies of motor-vehicle and occupational safety , improved family planning , chlorination of drinking water , smoke-free measures , and programs on decreasing chronic disease such as cancer , heart disease and more physical exercise .
Public health includes such parts as epidemiology , biostatistics , health services , environmental , social , behavioral , and occupational health .
Public health intervention prevents rather than treats a disease through surveillance of cases and promotes healthy behaviors such as hand washing , vaccination programs and distribution of condoms .
The two professional football teams in Enschede at that time ( Sportclub Enschede and Enschedese Boys ) had both money problems and were forced to merge .
Their office or position is the priesthood , a word which can also be used for such persons collectively .
However , some Anglican Churches allow women to be priests .
A priest or priestess is a person who is allowed to do religious rites .
It was the study of perception that gave rise to the Gestalt school of psychology , with its emphasis on holistic approach .
The oldest quantitative law in psychology is the Weber-Fechner law , which quantifies the relationship between the intensity of physical stimuli and their perceptual effects .
Perception is one of the oldest fields within scientific psychology , and there are correspondingly many theories about its underlying processes .
Silverstone Circuit is an English motor racing circuit next to the Northamptonshire villages of Silverstone and Whittlebury .
This informal race became known as the Mutton Grand Prix .
Silverstone Circuit is built on the site of RAF Silverstone , a World War II Royal Air Force bomber station .
The next year the Royal Automobile Club leased the airfield and set-up a more formal racing circuit .
Maurice Geoghegan , lived in Silverstone village and was knew that the airfield was deserted .
Silverstone was first used for racing by a group of friends who set up their own race in September 1947 .
The entry from Hangar Straight into Stowe Corner was modified in 1995 so as to make its entry less dangerous and less challenging .
Their first two races were held on the runways , with long straights and tight hairpin corners .
This arrangement was used for the 1950 and 1951 British Grands Prix .
Following the deaths of Ayrton Senna and Roland Ratzenberger at the 1994 San Marino Grand Prix , many Grand Prix circuits were modified in order to reduce speed and increase driver safety .
He and eleven other drivers raced over a two mile circuit .
For 1948 , it was decided to switch to the perimeter track .
The closest large towns are Northampton and Milton Keynes .

In 1991 it was made available as an online database , and handed over to the Australian National Botanic Gardens .
Two years later , responsibility for its maintenance has given to the newly formed Centre for Plant Biodiversity Research .
The Australian Plant Name Index ( APNI ) is an online database of all published names of Australian vascular plants .
It covers all names , whether current names , synonyms or invalid names .
It was compiled by Arthur Chapman , and was part of the Australian Biological Resources Study ( ABRS ) .
The project is aimed at providing integrated online access to the data and specimen collections of Australia 's major herbaria .
Two search interfaces are offered : Originally the idea of Nancy Tyson Burbidge , it began as a four-volume printed work of 3,055 pages .
It includes bibliographic and typification details , links to other resources , and data from the Census of Australian Vascular Plants divided by state .
It is notable for its graceful balance and for the rendering of the figure 's draped garments , depicted as if rippling in a strong sea breeze .
The Winged Victory of Samothrace ( or Nike of Samothrace ) is a Parian marble sculpture now in the Louvre , Paris , France .
Because defining a GSSP depends on finding well-preserved geologic sections and identifying key events , this task becomes more harder as one goes farther back in time .
Before 640 million years ago , boundaries on the geologic timescale are defined simply by reference to fixed dates , known as `` Global Standard Stratigraphic Ages '' .
A geologic section has to follow the rules to be adapted as a GSSP by the ICS .
As of 2012 , 64 of the 101 stages that need a GSSP have been decided .
A GSSP , more fully a Global Boundary Stratotype Section and Point , is an internationally agreed point which defines the start of a stage on the geologic time scale .
The work is done by the International Commission on Stratigraphy , a part of the International Union of Geological Sciences .
At the start of the Permian , the Earth was still at the grip of an Ice age from the Carboniferous .
The first modern trees ( conifers , ginkgos and cycads ) appeared in the Permian .
In the late Permian period , the drying continued although the temperature cycled between warm and cool cycles .
Glaciers receded around the mid-Permian period as the climate gradually warmed , drying the continent 's interiors .
The climate in the Permian was quite varied .
It is the last period of the Paleozoic era , and ended in the largest mass extinction known to science .
True Odonata appeared in the Permian .
Oberallgäu is a rural district in Swabia in southwest Bavaria , Germany .
In the south of the district are the Austrian states Tyrol and Vorarlberg .
The New Azerbaijan Party ( Yeni Azərbaycan Partiyası , YAP ) is the ruling political party in Azerbaijan since 1993 .
It was formed on 18 December 1992 by the former President of Azerbaijan Heydar Aliyev , who led it until his retirement and death in 2003 .
It is now led by his son , Ilham Aliyev , who succeeded his father as the party leader and as President of Azerbaijan since October 31 , 2003 .
The party 's stated ideologies are lawfulness , secularism , and Azerbaijani nationalism .
The founder of the party , Heydar Aliyev , was a member of the Communist Party of the Soviet Union until July 1991 before the collapse of the Soviet Union and the independence of Azerbaijan later that year .
It wants to build a `` social-oriented '' economy , meaning a middle path between socialism and `` laissez-faire '' capitalism ( a mixed economy ) , and lists civil solidarity and social justice as the basis of its ideology .
The museum holds mainly French art dating from 1848 to 1915 , including paintings , sculptures , furniture , and photography .
Its extensive collection of impressionist and post-impressionist masterpieces is the largest in the world .
After the construction for transforming it into the museum , in July 1986 , it became the Musée d'Orsay which has had the 2000 or so paintings , 600 sculptures and other works .

Cavan borders six other counties : Leitrim to the west , Fermanagh and Monaghan to the north , Meath to the south-east , Longford to the south-west and Westmeath to the south .
Other important wildlife protected lakes such as Lough Gowna and Lough Ramor are in the south and east of the county .
It is named after the town of Cavan .
The county contains forests such as Bellamont Forest near Cootehill , Killykeen Forest Park at Lough Oughter ( a Coillte state forest ) , Dún na Rí Forest Park and the Burren Forest .
The River Erne is a major river which rises from Beaghy Lough south of Stradone in Cavan and flows for 120 km ( 75 mi ) to Lough Erne .
A large area of lakes in the north and west of Cavan are marked as Specially Protected Areas ( SPA ) , example of this being Lough Oughter .
The Shannon Pot is the source of the River Shannon , the longest river in Ireland at 386 km ( 240 mi ) .
County Cavan ( in Gaelic , Contae an Chabháin ) is a county in Ireland .
At 18.8 km2 ( 7.3 sq mi ) , Lough Sheelin is the county 's largest lake situated in the south of the county .
It is part of the province of Ulster .
The highest point of the county is in the Breifne mountains , mount Cuilcagh at 665 metres ( 2,182 feet ) .
Cavan is known as ` The Lakeland County ' and it is said it has 365 lakes , one for every day of the year .
73,183 people live in the county according to the 2011 census .
Many rivers in Ireland start in County Cavan .

In creating their improvisational comedy series On the Campaign Trail with Larry & Lenny Lumberjack and talk show Tra5hTa1k with ILL Will , the ILL Clan blended real and virtual performance by creating the works on-stage and interacting with a live audience .
Matinee , a machinima software tool included with Unreal Tournament 2004 , popularized scripting in machinima .
Another solution is to blend in non-machinima elements , as nGame did by inserting painted characters with more expressive faces into its 1999 film Berlin Assassins .
Machinima creators have used different methods to handle limited character expression .
A filmmaker can work alone this way , as J. Thaddeus `` Mindcrime '' Skubis did in creating the nearly four-hour The Seal of Nehahra ( 2000 ) , the longest work of machinima at the time .
Another difference is that machinima is created in real time , but other animation is pre-rendered .
Rangers clan member Eric `` ArchV '' Fowler wrote his own programs to reposition the camera and to splice footage from the Quake demo file .
Similarly , Atussa Simon used a `` library of faces '' for characters in The Battle of Xerxes .
Because these are seen as low barriers to entry , machinima has been called a `` democratization of filmmaking '' .
However , Kelland , Morris , and Lloyd state that a small range of emotions is often sufficient , as in successful Japanese anime television series .
Some machinima creators use custom software .
In another combination of real and virtual worlds , Chris Burke 's talk show This Spartan Life takes place in Halo 2 's open multiplayer environment .
For example , Strange Company uses Take Over GL Face Skins to add more facial expressions to their characters filmed in BioWare 's 2002 role-playing video game Neverwinter Nights .
Unless what-you-see-is-what-you-get ( WYSIWYG ) editing is available , as in Vampire : The Masquerade - Redemption , changes may need to be verified in additional runs , and non-linear editing may be difficult .
Berkeley sees machinima as `` a strangely hybrid form , looking forwards and backwards , cutting edge and conservative at the same time '' .
Although other virtual theatrical performances have taken place in chat rooms and multi-user dungeons , machinima adds `` cinematic camera work '' .
Nitsche agrees that pre-recorded ( `` reel '' ) machinima tends to be linear and offers limited interactive storytelling ; he sees more opportunities in machinima performed live and with audience interaction .
Creators like Dutch director Chantal Harvey , producer of the 48 Hour Film Project Machinima sector , have created upwards of 200 films using the platform .
Popular genres include dance videos , comedy , and drama .
The Academy of Machinima Arts & Sciences ( AMAS ) , a non-profit organization dedicated to promoting machinima , recognizes exemplary productions through Mackie awards given at its annual Machinima Film Festival .
The director can use built-in camera controls , if available .
Machinima creators leave many rendering details to their host environments , but may thus inherit those environments ' limitations .
Harvey 's advocacy of the genre has resulted in the involvement of film director Peter Greenaway who served as a juror for the Machinima category and gave a keynote speech during the event .
To prevent confusion , Rooster Teeth 's characters move slightly when speaking , a convention shared with anime .
Strange Company produced its feature-length machinima film BloodSpell for less than # 10,000 .
Quake movie editing software later appeared , but the use of conventional non-linear video editing software is now common .
For example , Tristan Pope combined creative character and camera positioning with video editing to suggest sexual actions in his controversial film Not Just Another Love Story .
Machinima productions can remain close to their gaming roots and feature stunts or other portrayals of gameplay .
University of Cambridge experiments in 2002 and 2003 attempted to use machinima to re-create a scene from the 1942 live-action film Casablanca .
Kelland , Morris , and Lloyd list four main methods of creating machinima .
Some general film festivals accept machinima , and game companies , such as Epic Games , Blizzard Entertainment and Jagex , have sponsored contests involving it .
Pre-rendered scenes can require more digital storage space , weaken suspension of disbelief through contrast with real-time animation of normal gameplay , and limit interaction .
In digital puppetry , machinima creators become virtual actors ; each crew member controls a character in real-time , as in a multiplayer game .
The low cost caused a product manager for Electronic Arts to compare machinima to the low-budget independent film The Blair Witch Project , without the need for cameras and actors .
In the 2001 animated film Final Fantasy : The Spirits Within , every strand of hair on a character 's head was independent ; real-time needs would likely force them to be treated as a single unit .
A technique common in cut scenes of video games , scripting consists of giving precise directions to the game engine .
Explosions and stunts can be tried and repeated without monetary cost and risk of injury , and the host environment may allow unrealistic physical constraints .
Alternatively , some filmmakers attempt to stretch the boundaries of the rendering engines or to mask the original 3-D context .
Real-time engines need to trade quality for speed and use simpler algorithms and models .
However , Chris Burke intentionally hosts This Spartan Life in these unpredictable conditions , which are fundamental to the show .
Nitsche compared this experiment to an unpredictable Dogme 95 production .
When Diary of a Camper was created , no software tools existed to edit demo files into films .
In this respect , Kelland , Morris , and Lloyd compare scripting to stop-motion animation .
Filmmakers are often encouraged to follow traditional cinematic conventions , such as avoiding wide fields of view , the overuse of slow motion , and errors in visual continuity .
According to Marino , other disadvantages are the possibility of disruption when filming in an open multi-user environment and the temptation for puppeteers to play the game in earnest , littering the set with blood and dead bodies .
In the Halo video game series , helmets completely cover the characters ' faces .
Puppetry allows for improvisation and offers controls familiar to gamers , but requires more personnel than the other methods and is less precise than scripted recordings .
Machinima filming differed from traditional cinematography in that character expression was limited , but camera movements were more flexible and improvised .
Comparatively , machinimists using pre-made virtual platforms like Second Life have indicated that their productions can be made quite successfully with no cost at all .
From simple to advanced , these are : relying on the game 's AI to control most actions , digital puppetry , recamming , and precise scripting of actions .
Before using machinima , Burnie Burns and Matt Hullum of Rooster Teeth Productions spent US$ 9,000 to produce a live-action independent film ; in contrast , the four Xbox game consoles used to make Red vs. Blue in 2005 cost $ 600 .
Like live action , machinima is recorded in real-time , and real people can act and control the camera .
Another disadvantage is that , depending on the game , scripting capabilities may be limited or unavailable .
Other works filmed using puppetry are the ILL Clan 's improvisational comedy series On the Campaign Trail with Larry & Lenny Lumberjack and Rooster Teeth Productions ' Red vs. Blue .
In the post-production of Red vs. Blue : The Blood Gulch Chronicles , Rooster Teeth Productions added letterboxing with Adobe Premiere Pro to hide the camera player 's head-up display .
Berkeley weighs increased participation and a blurred line between producer and consumer against concerns that game copyrights limit commercialization and growth of machinima .
It may be possible to point the camera elsewhere or employ other creative cinematography or acting .
In recamming , which builds on puppetry , actions are first recorded to a game engine 's demo file format , not directly as video frames .
Previously , such virtual cinematic performances with live audience interaction were confined to research labs equipped with powerful computers .
However , some games , such as the Halo series , ( except for Halo PC and Custom Edition , which allow AI and custom objects and characters ) , allow filming only through puppetry .
In some cases , some game companies may provide such software ; examples include Epic Games ' Impersonator for Unreal Tournament 2004 and Valve Corporation 's FacePoser for Half-Life 2 .
Otherwise , video is captured from the perspectives of one or more puppeteers who serve as camera operators .
For example , Phil South inserted single , completely white frames into his work No Licence to enhance the visual impact of explosions .
There , others playing in earnest may attack the host or his interviewee .
Without re-enacting scenes , artists can then manipulate the demo files to add cameras , tweak timing and lighting , and change the surroundings .
However , perfecting scripts can be time-consuming .
Unlike live action , machinima involves less expensive , digital special effects and sets , possibly with a science-fiction or historical theme .
Although simple to produce , AI-dependent results are unpredictable , thus complicating the realization of a preconceived film script .
Machinima is a digital medium based on 3-D computer games , but most works have a linear narrative structure .
This technique is limited to the few engines and software tools that support it .
Because game animations focus on dramatic rather than casual actions , the range of character emotions is often limited .
Some , such as Red vs. Blue and The Strangerhood , follow narrative conventions of television situational comedy .
Individual instances were selected at different times to produce appropriate actions .
Machinima can be less expensive than other forms of filmmaking .
In other 3-D animation methods , creators can control every frame and nuance of their characters but , in turn , must consider issues such as key frames and in-betweening .
\ The AMAS defines machinima as `` animated filmmaking within a real-time virtual 3-D environment '' .
Kelland , Morris , and Lloyd argue that improvement in consumer-grade graphics technology will allow more realism ; For cut scenes in video games , issues other than visual fidelity arise .

Within six months , two gay activist organizations were formed in New York , concentrating on confrontational tactics , and three newspapers were established to promote rights for gays and lesbians .
After the Stonewall riots , gays and lesbians in New York City faced gender , class , and generational obstacles to becoming a cohesive community .
Those that did were often bars , although bar owners and managers were rarely gay .
Tensions between New York City police and gay residents of Greenwich Village erupted into more protests the next evening , and again several nights later .
Within weeks , Village residents quickly organized into activist groups to concentrate efforts on establishing places for gays and lesbians to be open about their sexual orientation without fear of being arrested .
Very few establishments welcomed openly gay people in the 1950s and 1960s .
Today , Gay Pride events are held annually throughout the world toward the end of June to mark the Stonewall riots .
Within a few years , gay rights organizations were founded across the U.S. and the world .
The Stonewall Inn at the time of the riots was owned by the Mafia .
Along with the liberal environment of Greenwich Village , these movements served as catalysts for the Stonewall riots .
It was popular with the poorest and most marginalized people in the gay community : drag queens , representatives of a newly self-aware transgender community , effeminate young men , hustlers , and homeless youth .
Similar marches were organized in other cities .
Police raids on gay bars were routine in the 1960s , but officers quickly lost control of the situation at the Stonewall Inn , and attracted a crowd that was incited to riot .
The Stonewall riots were a series of spontaneous , violent demonstrations against a police raid that took place in the early morning hours of June 28 , 1969 , at the Stonewall Inn .
On June 28 , 1970 , the first Gay Pride marches took place in Los Angeles , Chicago , and New York commemorating the anniversary of the riots .
These social movements included the African American Civil Rights Movement , the Counterculture of the 1960s , and antiwar demonstrations .
Early homophile groups in the U.S. sought to prove that gay people could be assimilated into society .
American gays and lesbians in the 1950s and 1960s faced an anti-homosexual legal system .

There is no connecting term involved , to indicate the rank Paraserianthes sect .
Bellis perennis is the name of a species , with perennis the specific epithet .
The purpose of a formal name is to have a single name that is accepted and used worldwide for a particular plant or plant group .
A name of a `` subdivision of a genus '' also needs a connecting term ( in the Acacia example above , this is `` subg . ''
In botany there are many ranks below that of species ( in zoology there is only one such rank , subspecies , so that this `` connecting term '' is unnecessary there ) .
The cultivar Bellis perennis ` Aucubifolia ' is a golden-variegated horticultural selection of this species .
pontica ( a Mediterranean hawthorn ) A name in three parts , i.e. , an infraspecific name ( a name for a taxon below the rank of species ) , needs a `` connecting term '' to indicate rank .
The connecting term is not part of the name itself .
americana ( American hedge bindweed ) Crataegus azarolus var .
Later it has been introduced worldwide , bringing it into contact with more languages .
In the Calystegia example above , this is `` subsp . ''
For botanical nomenclature , the ICBN prescribes a two-part name or binary name for any taxon below the rank of genus down to , and including the rank of species .
Depending on rank , botanical names may be in one part ( genus and above ) , two parts ( species and above , but below the rank of genus ) or three parts ( below the rank of species ) : in one part Plantae ( the plants ) Marchantiophyta ( the liverworts ) Pinophyta ( the conifers ) Magnoliopsida ( class including the family Magnoliaceae ) Asteridae ( subclass including the family Asteraceae ) Rosaceae ( the rose family ) Fragaria ( the strawberry genus ) in two parts Acacia subg .
A botanical name is a formal scientific name that follows the International Code of Nomenclature for algae , fungi , and plants ( ICN ) and , if it concerns a plant cultigen , the additional cultivar epithets ( one or more words in the scientific name of a taxon following the name of the genus or species ) must follow the International Code of Nomenclature for Cultivated Plants .
Taxa below the rank of species get a three part name .
The code of nomenclature covers `` all organisms traditionally treated as plants , whether fossil or non-fossil , e.g. blue-green algae ( Cyanobacteria ) ; fungi , including chytrids , oomycetes , and slime moulds ; photosynthetic protists and taxonomically related non-photosynthetic groups . ''
A binary name consists of the name of a genus and an epithet .
For example , the botanical name Bellis perennis was given to a plant species which is native to most of the countries of Europe and the Middle East , where it has various names in many languages .
Some English names for this plant species are : daisy , English daisy , lawndaisy .
Phyllodineae ( the wattles ) Citrus sinensis ( sweet orange ) in three parts Calystegia sepium subsp .
( for subspecies ) .
Indeed , presently no single morphological property is known , which would unify all the members of Laurales .
The order includes about 2500-2800 species from 85-90 genera , which comprise seven families of trees and shrubs .
The Laurales are an order of flowering plants .
Most of the species are tropical and subtropical , though a few genera reach the temperate zone .
The earliest lauraceous fossils are from to the early Cretaceous It is possible that the ancient origin of this order is one of the reasons for its highly diverged morphology .
The best known species in this order are those of the Lauraceae ( for example bay laurel or Laurus , cinnamon or Cinnamomum , avocado or Persea , and Sassafras ) , and the spice bush or Calycanthus of the Calycanthaceae .
This fact used to cause much argument among botanists regarding the correct circumscription of the order , and the presently accepted classification is based on recent molecular and genetic analysis .

Lettuce , tomatoes , feta , and olives are the most standard elements in an American `` Greek '' salad , but cucumbers , bell peppers , onions , radishes , dolmades , anchovies\/sardines and pickled hot peppers are common .
Rather than simple olive oil and vinegar , as in a μαρούλι - lettuce salad , prepared dressings containing various herbs and seasonings are frequently used .
In the Detroit , Michigan area , for example , a `` Greek salad '' also includes beets .
Various other salads have also been called `` Greek '' in the English language in the last century .
In these countries , the true Greek salad , when encountered , may be called by the Greek term horiatiki-pronounced ( hɔːriː ' ætɪkiː ) - or by such terms as `` country salad '' , `` peasant salad '' , or `` village salad '' , to avoid confusion .
This style of `` Greek salad '' is rarely encountered in Greece except in the homes of American Greeks or restaurants that cater to tourists .
In North America , Australia , South Africa and the United Kingdom , Greek salad has a different meaning : It is a lettuce salad , with Greek-inspired ingredients .
Greek salad is also found in other European countries for example Germany ( where it is often called Bauernsalat , literally farmers ' salad ) , France ( salade à la Grecque ) , Hungary ( görög saláta ) and Spain ( ensalada griega ) .
It is usually seasoned with salt , black pepper , and oregano and dressed with olive oil .
It is made of finely sliced lettuce , scallions , and fresh dill , and dressed with salt , black pepper , olive oil and red wine vinegar or lemon juice .
The salads of Greek cuisine are wide and varied .

The gene in question , when mutated , makes the Drosophila flies look unusual .
On the other hand , mice express TLRs 11 , 12 , and 13 , none of which is present in humans .
This identified TLR4 as one of the key components of the receptor for LPS .
TLR signalling leads to the induction or suppression of genes that orchestrate the inflammatory response .
Toll-like receptors are now counted among the key molecules that alert the immune system to the presence of microbial infections .
Other mammals may express TLRs that are not found in humans .
They got their name from their similarity to the protein coded by the Toll gene identified in Drosophila in 1985 by Christiane Nüsslein-Volhard .
Most mammalian species have between ten and fifteen types of Toll-like receptors .
TLR 4 function as a lipopolysaccharide ( LPS ) sensing receptor was discovered by Bruce A. Beutler and colleagues .
In 1996 , Toll was found by Jules A. Hoffmann and his colleagues to have an essential role in the fly 's immunity to fungal infection .
Toll-like receptors ( TLRs ) are proteins which act in the innate immune system and the digestive system .
These workers proved that mice which could not respond to LPS had mutations which abolished the function of TLR4 .
Once microbes get through physical barriers such as the skin or intestinal tract mucosa , they are recognized by TLRs .
For example , a gene coding for a protein like TLR10 in humans is present in mice , but seems to have been damaged at some time by a retrovirus .
Plant homologs were discovered in 1995 ( rice XA21 ) , and 2000 ( Arabidopsis FLS2 ) .
Thirteen TLRs ( TLR1 to TLR13 ) have been identified in humans and mice , and similar ones have been found in other mammalian species .
In all , thousands of genes are activated by TLR signalling , and the TLRs are one of the most important means of gene modulation .
TLRs are not identical in all mammals .
He became a naturalized citizen of the United States in 1943 .

In 1934 , he completed his Symphony No. 2 , his last purely orchestral work , conducted in Amsterdam and New York by Bruno Walter .

He wrote one more work with Brecht : the ballet The Seven Deadly Sins .
In Germany and Austria , there is a large variety of bread rolls , ranging from white rolls made with wheat flour , to dark rolls containing mostly rye flour .
Many variants include spices , such as coriander and cumin , nuts , or seeds , such as sesame seeds , poppy seed or sunflower seeds .
There are many names for bread rolls , especially in local versions of British English .
They are also common in both Australia and New Zealand , and very common in Canada .
An Italian form of bread roll is a small loaf of ciabatta which can be used to make a panino ( or panini ) .
In Denmark and Norway , rolls are called rundstykker ( literally `` round pieces '' ) and are comfort food eaten with butter for special weekend breakfasts .
Over time , most people started using one name to call all equal products regardless of whether it is right or not .
These were named depending on how the dough was made and how the roll was cooked .
It is the most visited national park in the United States .
The park has over 1,400 flowering plant species and over 4,000 species of non-flowering plants .
Park officials say there are more than 200 species of birds , 66 species of mammals , 50 species of fish , 39 species of reptiles , and 43 species of amphibians , including many lungless salamanders .
Over 100 species of trees grow in the park .
There are 850 miles ( 1,368 km ) of trails and unpaved roads in the park for hiking .
Great Smoky Mountains National Park is a national park in the United States .
The lower forests are mostly deciduous leafy trees .
Sixteen mountains in the park reach higher than 6,000 feet ( 1829 m ) .
The highest point is Clingmans Dome at 6,643 feet ( 2,025 m ) .
The park is along the Great Smoky Mountains , which are part of the Blue Ridge Mountains .
The park also offers backpacking and camping .
At higher altitudes , there are more coniferous trees .
It is also a UNESCO World Heritage Site .
A bit is a type of equipment that is put in a horse 's mouth to help control it .
The mouthpiece of the bit is the part that goes into the horses mouth .
It is attached to a bridle to hold it on the horse 's head , and to reins which the rider holds and allows them to control and cue the horse .
A Cocos dialect of Malay and English are the main languages spoken and 80 % of Cocos Islanders are Sunni Muslim .
In the 1970s , Australian government dissatisfaction with the Clunies-Ross feudal style of rule of the island increased .
By agreement the family retained ownership of Oceania House , their home on the island .
In 1978 , Australia forced the family to sell the islands for the sum of AU$ 6,250,000 , using the threat of compulsory purchase .
On November 23 1955 , the islands were transferred to Australian control under the Cocos ( Keeling ) Islands Act 1955 .
Instead the Australian government ordered that no government business was to be given to his shipping company , an action which contributed to his bankruptcy .
However , in 1983 the Australian government moved to dishonor this agreement , and told the former last ruler , John Clunies-Ross , that he should leave the Cocos .
The Territory of Cocos ( Keeling ) Islands , also called Cocos Islands and Keeling Islands , is a territory of Australia .
There are two atolls and twenty-seven coral islands in the group .
John Clunies-Ross lives in exile in Perth , Australia , but his successors still live on the Cocos .
In 2004 there were 629 people living on the Cocos ( Keeling ) islands .

Fossil DNA evidence suggests muskoxen were not only more geographically widespread during the Pleistocene , but also more genetically diverse .
During that time , other populations of muskoxen lived across the Arctic , from the Ural Mountains to Greenland .
Together with the bison and the pronghorn , the muskox was one of a few species of Pleistocene megafauna in North America to survive the Pleistocene\/Holocene extinction event and live to the present day .
Muskoxen live in Arctic North America and Greenland , with small introduced populations in Sweden , Siberia and Norway .
The muskox ( Ovibos moschatus , musk ox ) is a large Arctic mammal of the Bovidae family .

At the house , Sharik gets to know Dr. Preobrazhensky 's household , which includes Doctor Bormenthal , Professor 's student and protegé and two female servants .
Instead of giving them their own room , as Sharikov demands , the Professor takes the woman aside and explains that Sharikov is the product of a lab experiment gone horribly wrong .
Then , to his surprise , successful surgeon Filip Filippovich Preobrazhensky arrives and offers the dog a piece of sausage .
Bormenthal then suggests that they redo the operation , using the body of a genius .
In conclusion , the Professor refuses to permit Sharikov 's murder or to undo the operation , which could easily kill him as well .
Again Bormenthal beats Sharikov up and makes him promise not to do anything of the sort .
Soon after Sharikov brings home a female co-worker , whom he introduces to the Professor as his new common law wife .
In the aftermath , the fully canine Sharik blissfully resumes his status as a gentleman 's dog .
Soon after , Sharikov returns , explaining that he has been granted a job by the Soviet State .
Later , Bormenthal begs the Professor for permission to dose Sharikov with arsenic , calling him a man with `` the heart of a dog '' .
Over the days that follow , the Professor and Bormenthal look far more relaxed than at any time before Sharikov 's arrival .
As a result , Sharikov curses in front of women , refuses to shave , and dresses like a slob .
Instead , Sharikov refuses and draws a revolver .
That night , an ominous silence reigns in the flat and the lights are left on for many hours after bedtime .
Again the Professor refuses , explaining that the operation was meant to improve the human race .
Breaking with his former beliefs , the Professor admits that any peasant woman could give birth to a genius and that eugenics are a waste of time .
Infuriated , Sharikov leaves the apartment and remains gone for several days .
Explaining that nothing is going to happen to him due to the State 's distrust of Sharikov , the Party official departs .
Impressed by his new master , Sharik slips easily into the role of `` a gentleman 's dog '' .
In the aftermath , the Professor and Bormenthal patiently attempt to teach Sharikov basic etiquette .
During the weeks after the operation , the household is stunned as Sharik begins transforming into an incredibly unkempt human .
The Professor is horrified and orders Bormenthal not to `` slander the dog '' .
Meanwhile , Sharikov turns the Professor 's life into a living hell .
Enraged , Bormenthal beats Sharikov up and forces him to apologize .
The Professor explains the change as a natural phenomenon , although it is obvious to the reader that in fact he and Bormenthal have simply performed the reverse operation .
The following day , a senior Party official arrives and tells the Professor that Sharikov has denounced him to the secret police , the Cheka .
Enraged , the Professor and Bormenthal pounce upon him .
Unintimidated , the Professor orders Bormenthal to summon Sharikov , who is slowly being transformed back into a dog .
Instead , Sharikov mocks the idea of manners as relics of Tsarism .
As a result , he refuses to decrease his seven room flat and treats the Bolsheviks on the housing committee with contempt .
He insists that it is better to behave , as he puts it , `` naturally '' .
Despite the Professor 's vocal anti-communism , his frequent medical treatment of the Party leaders makes him untouchable .
Moscow , 1924 .
He now spends his work-day strangling vagrant cats , whose fur is used to imitate that of squirrels .
He explains that the human body parts , which came from a drunken proletarian , are responsible for all of Sharikov 's defects .
However , he is soon terrified to see the Professor bringing home a human brain and removing the pituitary gland ...

Several details of its decoration , particularly the ` syncopated arches ' and the use of Purbeck marble shafts , reflect the influence of St Hugh 's Choir at Lincoln Cathedral , built a few years earlier .
Northwold 's chancel , completed by around 1252 , adopted several of the stylistic elements already used in the Galilee porch .
A ` Galilee ' porch was added under Bishop Eustace ( 1198-1215 ) in the Early English Gothic style .
The main transepts were built early on , crossing the nave below a central tower , and are the oldest surviving part of the cathedral .
The Anglo-Saxon church was demolished , but some of its relics , such as the remains of its benefactors , were moved to the cathedral .
Construction work continued throughout the 12th century .
Work began on a new eastern end in 1234 , replacing the short Norman chancel with a much grander 10-bay structure .
The Western transepts and tower were completed in an exuberant Romanesque style with a rich decoration of intersecting arches and complex mouldings .

Manierre Dawson ( December 22 , 1887 , Chicago , Illinois - August 15 , 1969 , Sarasota , Florida ) was an avant-garde painter and sculptor .
After working for a year with a firm of architects , he was granted a six-month leave-of-absence for an educational tour of Europe .
In Sienna , he met and exchanged ideas on painting with John Singer Sargent .
1911 through 1914 were the most productive years of his career .

If weight is used , the specific impulse is in units of time .
It is also called the effective exhaust velocity .
Specific impulse is a useful value to compare rocket or jet engines .
When specific impulse is measured as a speed , it has another name .
Specific impulse ( often shortened to Isp ) is a way to describe how well a rocket performs .
When the amount of fuel is measured in mass , the specific impulse is expressed as a speed .
